text: One of my favorite dessert spots. Unique decor and yummy treats! Awesome central location and fast service. I would recommend the Sesame Street snoh treat. Magically delicious.
Service was amazing and their teas/slush/ice cream is amazing! I wish I would have been able to find this place earlier...

I love this alternative to ice cream and froyo. I love the taro and condensed milk glaze. The topping can be interchangeable. So far I really love it with almonds cause I love the crunch. The shaved ice is great cause it isn't too heavy and it's just sweet enough. This place is definitely a place to try!
I really like this place. I always order whatever they recommend and it is delicious.  They have interesting art, plenty of seating, and great service

I've been here twice already In a row. I loved it the first time. I was searching for a new place to get ice cream but it is better than ice cream. Fast service and reasonably priced ! It will not disappoint you, the minute you walk in it already looks amazing.
Never had anything like it. Very impressed with the different spin on shaved ice,  lots of variety,  swanky and new decoration.  Date night worthy. We'll definitely be back!

I like this place a lot. I didn't know what the concept was at first, but then I ate it and thought it was really cool. It isn't shaved ice, it is a lighter version of that. It is very light shaved ice. I always get the strawberry, with Oreos and nutella. It is amazing!! I recommend this place.

Got a small taro snow with red bean and condensed milk and it was delicious. I thought it was actually pretty big for a small, but would be good for sharing. Also got a thai iced tea with boba. The boba has great consistency and tastes just right.

Awesome place to hang out and enjoy some sweet treats. I usually come here for the Snoh. It's a light and fluffy shaved ice with very unique Asian influenced flavors. I've tried the taro, thai, green tea, and mango snow so far. All delicious, but I do favor the thai tea and taro with mochi toppings and a black sesame drizzle. I have yet to taste their drink selection though.
The most delicious thing I've ever had  kind of expensive but I think it's worth it. Very busy but fast service and the staff is very nice.

I've been to Snoh quite a bit and absolutely love it. There is always something great for my kids, me, my spouse, and my friends. In my experience, the owner is very considerate and willing to take the time to make sure newbies know all the options. I just took a friend there today and she adored it. Great food, friendly staff, wonderful vibe.

I don't normally write reviews but I figured I needed to just get this out there as it really has bugged me...  My friend and I walked in there (we had came over from next door), to see what this place was all about. We got a long drawn out explanation as to what it was and we were really pressured to buy one to try and not just that, but to get a large!!! I was really put off by the salesman "pushing" of the product so much so that we just decided to leave! I really wish they would at least give a sample to try rather then some overly-dramatized-your-life-will-be-forever-changed-just-buy-it speech..I hope that maybe in the future this place learns to be a little more laid back with how they first present themselves to new customers, otherwise this stuck up intimidation is going to just turn away a lot more customers.   Ill stick to Tea Snow in Mesa (you are not the only Asian shaved ice place in Az as your pompous salesperson claims either)...

All I can say is YUM!! Snoh has a cool little vibe going on. The shop itself has cool art work and books to read. I got the Coconut Snoh with no topping and it was like eating a little bowl of heaven. I don't know if I liked the novelty of it's snow like texture or if I liked the fact that it was just that dang good. Regardless, it's definitely not a snow cone. If you want something a little different you might want to check this place out.

Dear Nice Folks at Snoh,  If you look into the till, you'll see that you have a lot of my cash. Not that you'd be able to tell it apart from the cash from your other loyal customers, but it's there nonetheless. Personally, I blame you all for putting in such a nice, comfy, artsy hangout spot with delicious Taiwanese-style ice. I blame you for making such delicious thai tea flavored Snoh that now I have a full-on addiction. I don't know if there's SA (Snoh Anonymous) but I'm sure if such a thing existed, I'd be on the roster.   I'm a longtime customer of Cherry Blossom/Tokyo Express and had been wondering about this new joint setting up shop next door. At the recommendation of my friends (one of whom is in the frozen yogurt biz), I came in to try Snoh and now I feel like Frosty the little freakin' Snoh-Elf. My favorite is the thai tea Snoh with boba and condensed milk (or black sesame glaze). My favorite thing is that when the the milk tea Snoh melts, BOOM! You got milk tea! It's a two-fer!  Anyhoozle, thanks to the nice folks at Snoh for opening their doors just as the weather is heating up. Prep the till, gentlemen, more of my cash is going to be making its home there this Summer!
This place is great! Amazing flavor combinations and great service! Cold weather or Hot, you can't deny the warm atmosphere. Love it, will always come back!

The snow was kind of watery but considering this was the first time I've had snow, it was good. Decently price. I also had the regular milk tea with boba on a different day. The boba was very soft and chewy= perfect. The drink itself, however, was too watered down. I had them remake it thinking it was a fluke (they did claim they have San Gabriel Valley, CA standards) but it tasted the same.   If you're from CA: pass on the milk tea, try the snow (I haven't had class 302 so I don't know how it compares to it)  The owner and staff there is super nice, I hope they improve their milk tea flavoring, I'm willing to come back and support them!

I'm from Taiwan, where boba milktea originated from. I can speak with confidence that SNOH has the most genuine boba milktea I've ever had in Arizona. Besides that, all of my friends who have tried their Taro Snoh agreed that it tastes just like what we had back in Asia!  SNOH is absolutely a worth-trying dessert place with amazingly genuine products :-)  We accidentally visited SNOH during their first week of opening...it's love at first taste. Till now, I'm still willing to drive all the way from Tempe for a cup of taro Snoh with mochi balls; I never get disappointed by any of their products (the latest pumpkin flavor Snoh is awesome); I can never get tired of spreading good words about SNOH; and I've just made my first Yelp review for SNOH :-D

Coming from LA, I eat shaved snow a lot. SNOH kept it real and their flavors were great! We ordered every flavor and I have to say I really like the Green Tea. Definitely get boba and egg pudding with the green tea, it tastes amazing!   I docked off a star because the mochi was a little too hard for my taste.

I absolutely love this place. I love that they have a variety of things to do there while you're hanging out having a good time! My daughters have so much fun whenever we play UNO or connect four a while were eating our shaved ice !  I'm super excited about heading to the downtown location this weekend! I hope they have a vendor at the downtown public market as well!

I love this kind of snow shaved ice since I tried it oversea years ago.  I am glade to reunite with it again.  Tried the green tea flavor with almond pudding, boba, and black sesame glaze. Though they still put the glaze over the ice when I asked to have it on the side, it was not over powering or over sweet. Snow texture is right. Pudding is good. Boba was old, too sweet, and somehow stick together like an army instead of individual ball. They told me the price for just the ice without any topping or any glaze would be the same. Which is $7 for a large. I think it's kinda pricy for just plain plate of shaved ice.   Will go back for sure, just cause it's hot out there and that's one refreshing happy treat for me~

I went there a lot and really like this place for the shaved ice.I did try the green milk tea before it tastes well but I ordered no ice for this time it tastes like watery I asked them why they said no ice they added water..it did taste like a milk plus water plus sugar .they can charge more money for no ice but add water is really bad for the taste .nobody want to spend 4 dollars plus get a tea tastes like watery...really disappointed

Their Thai teas and bobas are amazing! This is my new favorite spot I will be definitely coming back! I always thought there wasn't a lot of good boba shops in Phoenix until a friend recommended me here and they are perfect

"Snoh way anything frozen can taste this good!"    Selfishly I don't want to recommend this place because of the possibility of making this so popular that I worry that there wouldn't be enough supply for my demand.  However my rating would suffice in this easy recommendation.  One of the easiest description to this would be frozen cotton candy.  The uncanny fluffiness to this desert marvel topped with fruit toppings and condensed milk is a taste you'll be back for more. This is simply a no-brainer during 115 degree weather, but the shaved ice is a treat you worth having even during cold days of Arizona.  Though I haven't tried the Snoh drinks, I would give it a try at my next stop.    Service is friendly and they make good recommendations.  The place with it's trendy decor, Instagram artwork and Flat screen TVs adds to your visual stimulation as you wait for your desert.  I would opt for the large size in a dish with split flavors with original and something you're willing to try.    My only hope is that my fantastic review doesn't get lost in the "filtered" black hole of reviews for the site.  If you find this useful, funny, or cool please check accordingly.

The tea was great so give on that but the boba was too firm. Might of just been that day so definitely don't let this review stop you from trying it out. Plus there desserts definitely looked five star so I will be back for that.

this place doesn't even deserve one star. if you've had snoh anywhere else, you would know this is not good quality. on top of the lack of taste, their service is TERRIBLE. I waited 30 mins for a cup of water and left because I never received it. Workers were rude and ignored my request multiple times. save yourself the trouble and money, don't go to this place.

Never been there until today and I gotta say I'm impressed. I've been to many boba tea places and I've never seen the "snoh" shaved ice before. It's delicious. I wish they would have a blended menu, however, it was an overall awesome experience.
If I could put no stars I would.  The people were rude. My slushy was more like an icy and when I asked for it to be remade they went to the back and brought out the same drink. Never again

This is my favorite place to get refreshing milk tea and slushies! The pistachio flavor is very yummy. Small place but it has a great atmosphere. It does tend to get busy later in the day but with their downtown location it's helped the overflow of people.

Snoh is the perfect place to escape the heat and try something new! The flavors and texture of their shaved ice is unlike anything I've had before and there is no better place for it in AZ!   I love the taro root and original flavors, but I don't think you can go wrong with any of them. I was iffy on the black sesame sauce the first time I tried it, but I am now converted into a fan.  Condensed milk and caramel are delicious as well. Staff is always very nice and there are comfy chairs and even games to play if you want to hang out for awhile.
Love Snoh!  Cute ice cream shop and i love their #12!.. It's so yummy & chewy.  I only give 4 stars, because it's a bit pricey.

Disappointed with this place, I thought the atmosphere was weird and try hard. I ate outside with my fianc√© because we both didn't want to be in there. Also, I don't think it's appropriate for your employees to be showing there whole stomach in a short cropped top. I get that this is a "hipster" place but be a little more professional. After I saw her skimpy outfit I lost my appetite. I wasn't even in the shop that long to hear at least 10 curse words. This place is extremely unprofessional and i will never be coming back. Also the texture of the snow was just not for me, I found it okay but mainly disgusting all together. Too expensive also! Not worth your time.
Let a line of 8 ppl build up with nobody at the register. No employee in sight. Somebody finally found a bell and they came out, but really 8 ppl?! I got a strawberry iced tea. Tasted like flowers.
Best ever, amazing, addicting! It is so different from shaved ice and so addicting! I come way too often!
My favorite! The employees are always so nice and easy going. The mango slushie with boba is my fave! This location is always busy, but the service is always fast!  Also love the rewards program.

It was good, I would go back, but not doing cartwheels over it. Can't really go wrong with what u order unless you're a picky eater. The staff could be a bit more descriptive about the flavors, taste and what the hell you're eating.

My first time coming to Snoh was an average experience. The selection was short and sweet, that's what I like most. The ice shavery is light and good. The owners need to work on their customer service though.The individual at the cash register was very friendly but the other two just stare at you and very discourteous. I wouldn't come here again until it improves.  I also ordered half green tea and half Thai and they only gave me Thai.
This is an amazing place to kick back and enjoy a light treat. The employees are so friendly and helpful with suggestions. By far my favorite dessert place.

I visited Snoh when I was passing through AZ-- and I'm drooling just thinking about it. I went there after a few drinks so I had no idea what I was ordering. I had never tried (or heard of) Thai snow, or taro snow, or mochi balls or boba-- and I never had shaved ice cream with Cinnamon Toast Crunch. I fell in love, and the love quickly turned into sadness because I couldn't believe I was missing out all this time. I started taking pictures of everyone's ice cream for sweet memories.

Snoh has the best shaved ice in all of Phoenix. Sadly my boyfriend doesn't like shaved ice so I don't get here enough :(. I'm OBSESSED with the taro shaved ice! The toppings are also absolutely amazing (yum, condensed milk and mochi!)

I really enjoy their milk teas with boba but lately they haven't been steady in quality. The boba last night wasn't ready and came out hard. I went last week and the boba again had an issue, it was tasteless. I hope they can find a way to serve consistent products.

First visit was last night, last visit was last night.   Interesting idea but flavor was lacking compared to other frozen desserts.  Real snow may have more flavor.  I selected a basic mix using the original shaved ice with oreo's and chocolate topping.  The guy behind the counter thought it was so funny he called out to some friends sitting at a nearby table to share my order with them so everyone could have a good laugh at my expense. WOW, great customer service.   Between the insulting customer service and plain tasting dessert, I won't be back.

Snoh is an excellent concept for the Arizona heat & those who are looking for a way to treat themselves without all the guilt. The place has a very hip ambiance (lots of fun stuff to look at while you have desert), it's clean, & the staff is very friendly. I HIGHLY recommend the Taro flavor with Oreo cookies, sesame glaze, & whatever else you're into for toppings. I purchased a small & got back in line to purchase a regular haha I never do that but I was excited about my new find...mmmm fluffy texture & great flavor

I love Snoh! Me and my brothers go every chance we get. I always end up ordering 2/3 different items off the menu. The owner is the greatest and sweetest guy you will meet. Snoh is the must try place and hot spot to be at. Really worth it!

Frequented Snoh since they opened for their teas and boba, and was always pretty bummed that they didn't have a dairy free option for me to try.   BUT NOW THEY DO!!  The coconut milk snoh is amazing. Creamy and light all at once (its magical!), with a whole bunch of toppings and glaze options.   Their teas are super yummy and I love that they actually carry boba! My husband is obsessed with the taro milk tea.   Their loyalty/stamp card is one of the few that I always remember to bring in my wallet. Yay for free snoh!  Only a few bummers to be aware of-  They always seem to be out of at least one flavor whenever I go in.   Parking sucks. They share a lot with several other businesses/restaurants that is barely big enough for them alone. Not their fault, but something to remember. Carpool.   Can't tip on a card =(
This place is so delicious!!! I always get the taro and honeydew or pistachio plus strawberries and mango or mochi balls with condensed milk!

So my friend and I wanted some dessert, and my friend hyped up this place completely, she was like, "we have to go it's so worth it" and our asses were on the other side of town, but we wanted to complete this mission. So we went ahead and went. First off, the smell was amazing! I think it was the toast that they were making that smelled AMAZING. it smelled delicious! I wanted to buy one, but I had to stick to what they're made for. Oh! And it's right next to the Cherry Blossom Cafe, my fave restaurant. Anyways back to this review! The atmosphere and the music was so so so so cute! They had sick paintings and decor! And the music had my head  bobbing all while I was there. They had a Toro light switch in the bathroom, it was so cute. AND it smelled good! As for customer service, I had nothing to complain about, they were so nice! Now I was really confused on what I wanted so my friend told me to get regular snow, which I completely regret getting. Do NOT get regular snoh! Please! It'll taste like... Ugh just regular ice! I was eating ice w caramel, graham crackers and Oreos ._. I was mad, but I still ate it. I feel like if I would have Gotten an actual flavor I would have love love loved. but why would someone recommend ICE flavored snoh? Anyways, I'm definitely coming back. Just not for ice flavored snoh lmao.

Best shaved ice in town! The only down fall today was the guy at the register today had like an attitude today or something. I didn't get his name but he had tattoos and an LA hat on. Other than that the taro snoh was really good. Also, i had a strawberry iced tea. Great after taste.

The only thing I have negative to say about Snoh is the fact that I have to drive so far to get some!  Awesome selection of shaved ice options, great people and service with a fun atmosphere to enjoy your delicious and cool treat!

I have only been here once and I thought I was in for a treat, however the snoh dessert I got was not very tasteful. It was a bland mix of fruits and really left me yearning for another place to cure my craving. I'm sure there are people who will love this place however it is not for me.

Love this place! Chic, cute with some Asian deco elements, and the most important, the shaved ice is so yummy!!!  3 of us came after a Saturday brunch, ordered a large size of Taro and Original shaved ice, paired with sweet red beans and mango fruit (they also offer mango jelly), and topped with caramel drizzle. Maybe because of our choice, this plate was very very sweet. If you don't like sweet that much, choose something different. The large size was definitely enough for 3 of us! The shaved ice was very fine, fluffy and felt like cotton candy! And as it melts, it seems to be more like ice cream than ice. The texture is very different from the other shaved ice I have tried where you can feel more of the ice.   If Snoh was not 20 miles away from me, i would visit at least once a week! Can't wait for the next visit :)
The snow was great. Boba had a good constancy. I'd come back again for the snow, but definitely not for the service. The cashier guy with the tattoos was rude.
Very innovative "ice cream".  They have great boba too!!  Love it.

BEST SNOH IN THE WEST COAST  "!!! If you've never tried it you're in for a great treat. Bypass the ice cream and try something new great date place. Tried other places but there is no competition when it comes to this place. Love it love it love it

This is our favorite icecream shop in Phoenix! We get the taro snoh with strawberries, red beans or mochi with condensed milk. Our almost 2 year old says "yummy" after each spoonful of snoh! I say yummy to their house blend milk tea with a scoop of icecream.

Let it Snoh, Let it Snoh, Let it Snoh!   This place is has a cool vibe to it..... the ambiance is chic, the place is modern/clean, and they should just install a revolving door in front with the amount of traffic they get at this place!  Seriously, there's always a line when we visit - but it's worth the wait!   The flavored snoh they create are so fine it's almost like eating ice cream instead of shaved ice.  They have quite unique flavors, toppings, and glazes.... from the traditional green tea ice with red bean and condensed milk (one of my favorite combinations) to the more westernized strawberry snoh with fresh strawberries and chocolate glaze, there's quite a range of combinations that can be had.   We've also tried their boba, thai tea, taro snoh, mochi, sesame glaze.... all yummy in various combinations! Now, if they would only open a location closer to where I live so I don't have to drive 15 miles to play with snoh......

I think the boba drinks and snow are decent.  I just think the manager/owner, or whoever he is, is a bit pompous and frankly a bit rude.  From what I've read it is a fairly common experience/behavior.  I'll probably end up going again b/c it's close to Cherry Blossom but I would think twice about going in if I saw him working.
Took my daughter here on Saturday. Cute little shop lots of seating and great artwork! I had the milk snoh with boba, moochi, and condensed milk. Loved it, can't wait to return.

Finally, a good boba place in Central Phx! I'm giving it four stars for not having more tea flavors (there's only about 4 flavors each for milk tea and for regular tea) but overall I've enjoyed the boba teas I've tried there.  I personally like their Thai tea and Taro tea - have not tried the Almond or Milk tea flavors.  I've tried the snoh but I'm not as big a fan as I am of boba in general.  I like that the boba has been consistently chewy every time I order it and that the tea is well mixed - no granules at the bottom of my cup.  My husband can't bring himself to deviate from the snoh - he mixes it up all the time, but he tends to get the thai snoh or the original flavor and puts mochi, strawberries, and black sesame glaze.  We love the location (super enabling since it's 10 mins away from our place) and usually don't have to wait too long for our order.  It's in the same center as Cherry Blossom Cafe, Tokyo Express, and a few other relatively busy places, so parking can be a premium at peak food times.  We've usually gone on the weekend or towards the end of the day and have only had a problem finding a spot once or twice.  Try not to look for a spot in the front - go to the left and park towards the back.  You'll get your fix faster and with less stress!

My bf and I just recently moved to AZ and we were on a hunt to find the best dessert place in town. Snoh Ice Shavery easily became one of our favorites. We even brought family and friends when they visited us and they loved it too. My favorite thing to order is Taro snoh with some mochi, custard pudding, and honey boba, glazed with condensed milk. It's making my mouth water just thinking about it lol

A new favorite in Phoenix! Was craving for Boba and stopped in. The menu is just the right size. Not too many selections to confuse, but enough to satisfy. Had the passion fruit and lychees Boba with half the sugar. Made just right at a great price!  What a great find in Phoenix. Going to try the shaved ice next.

Snoh is the antidote to summer in Phoenix. Cool and fun inside with so many available combinations of Snoh, add ins and toppings. It's almost as much fun to imagine the creations as it is to eat it! Snoh is a flavored milky ice shaved in sheets to a soft, noncrunchy consistency.   We had strawberry with lychee jelly and condensed milk (quite sweet,) a Gotcha Matcha (matcha with red beans and mochi topped with condensed milk -regular size was pretty darn big,) and a #8 pistachio, custard jelly with almonds and a little caramel. Each one was finished until it looked like we had licked the bowls!   Cold and custom made so you can tailor the amount of sweetness to your palate. Delicious!

I'm hooked!   I searched far and wide for a Boba tea joint in the valley. This seems to be the only one and it isn't a bad thing. The boba is fresh and flavorful and the Thai tea is delicious!  The "snoh"  is a very unique cold dessert. It is light like cotton candy, but creamier than shaved ice. It's a perfect fit for somebody who is trying to find a new way to relieve themselves from the brutal Arizona summer.   I recommend trying out the combinations that they have on the rolling display first to find your taste and go from there.   You can't go wrong with anything at his place. Some of the ingredients sound foreign but I haven't had something yet that tastes bad. Find your flavor baseline and you will never go back. I am done with froyo, Hawaiian ice and Gelato as long as I stay within driving distance from my new found frozen obsession, Snoh.

Not my cup of Snoh. I tried the number 8; pistachio Snoh, pudding, caramel, and sliced almonds. The sliced almonds were the only thing I could taste. Everything else was bland and just tasted sweet. Too sweet that I couldn't finish my small cup.  Not worth the calorie consumption. Not sure I would go back.

This place is awesome!  Snoh is delicious!   Interesting flavors and toppings. This spot is clean and hip. Owner is cool and helpful when you aren't sure what you want!  Definitely give this place a try!  Green tea with lychee jelly glazed with condensed milk - YUM!  Give it a try!  Definitely will be back!
Awesome place. Tastes better than the same old frozen yogurt and appears to be more healthy (depending on syrups and toppings of course).

Would love to give this place a higher review because their boba and thai tea are the best in town. But service weighs more to me than the taste. The owner is unpleasant, rude and does not treat his regulars or even customers with respect.

Best shaved ice desserts ever!!! Also their milk tea with boba is awesome and you can get it blended! The milk tea smoothie tastes awesome just like the milk tea place at pikes place in Seattle!!!! Definitely recommend to anyone!

I will definitely admit i am here every week. I come here for the boba, because it is not only like the only boba place in central phoenix but their boba is perfectly cooked (IMO) 98% of the time. Strawberry tea and thai tea, both with boba, every visit. Occasionally, we will have a small cup of shaved iced.  Drinks/Boba - excellent  Shaved ice (condensed milk!!!!!) - excellent  Brick toast (around $10) - ehhh, pass  Atmosphere - super chill, board games, Nintendo, etc  Art - awesome, local  It's always busy here but they bust out orders pretty quickly.

This place is awesome, the service by Judith and Kim was excellent they have good recommendations, it's a great place to chill and have your favorite drink, the only reason I give it five stars is because I can't give it six it's simply dope.
This is the best place to get dessert. It's really nice with a refreshing Asian theme. There's nothing quite like it I've ever seen. Would recommend to anyone that loves good quality.
Look forward to coming back to this amazing not to mention yummy in your tummy spot! Not only is it tasty the staff if friendly too just wish they had a larger sitting area at times :)
This place is an awesome place to go to with friends; I love the tea and yogurt!!!  Highly recommend it!
So delicious. I live down the street and I can't help but go every time I have a spare minute! I always get thai tea snoh with green tea mochi balls and black sesame, I'm addicted
Very cool (no pun intended) way to enjoy something nice and cold on a hot day that isn't ice cream. The staff is awesome and happy to help you create yummy combinations.

I don't know honestly what to say, because you have to honestly try it yourself to experience how amazing this ice/cream/but not the two combined in a way lol, thing is. Holy cow the first bite was simply mouthwatering for more. It's an amazing deal with a huge amount for a small at $4.00 and only 50 cents per extra topping. Free glaze of course. Support local business by trying this crazy good dessert!!

I love Boba and always like trying new places, but Snoh Ice Shavery has the worst customer service i've experienced in all Boba shops in Phoenix! To start off the Asian guy with the tattoos that looks like he's in his 20's, was soo rude! I came with my non- english speaking mother and while I was translating her order he gave us the wierdest looks, not to mention that since it was my first time there he was being a sarcasstic asshole when I asked what they had on the menu! I was so outraged!!! He then aggressively handed me the cups like as if he never had someone ask about the menu? He did this to us but not to the WHITE or ASIAN customers. Never coming to this place again and I definitely told my friends about the wonderful experience I had here ! BTW and the Boba didn't even have any flavor it tasted so watery as did the snoh! I'm sticking on going to BOMBOBA their customer service is 1000x better than this shit.

This was our first time there tonight and it was amazing. The gentleman was very patient as my daughters didn't know what they wanted. It was great. I would highly recommend it. Prices were decent too.

We have been here three times in two weeks if that's any indication of how much we love this place. I gotta admit I was a bit weary and it intimated by the crazy look and unfamiliar flavored but now they are flavors I know and love. Take the leap. I didn't think anything could be better than ice cream but apparently I was wrong.
Good stuff!  I wished I remembered what I got......but it was good.  Different product and they did a great job on the remodel.  I didn't expect to find this venue in this center.

I love this place! Unique flavors, glazes, and toppings. I love the Thai Tea with sweetened, condensed milk glaze and boba! Delicious. My only reason for a 4 star instead of 5, is the service was SLOW!

My husband and I came here via Groupon because the concept was so intriguing! We were not disappointing and will be returning. You should go if you like Thai flavors and desserts with a bit of a twist. Funky pictures and atmosphere. Cool!

I know when I first looked at the pictures they did NOT look appetizing. Boy was I wrong.  It's such a good creamy treat that's still really light. Great assortment of flavors, I'm a fan of the taro and Thai tea.  The topping offerings are also good-- sesame seeds, almond yogurt, boba, coconut jelly, CONDENSED MILK!!! If you don't know what condensed milk is, try it with the taro shave ice and put that on top. It will change your life.  It's really unfortunate that I live so close to this place... for my wallet and my belly.

Snoh is interesting in that it is really, one of a kind. At least here in the valley. It's taiwanese shaved ice, where they freeze blocks of this stuff and shave it in delicate layers into your bowl. The first (and only time) prior to Snoh I'd had it up in the Bay area, and was smitten. Fluffy! Sweet! Cold! Just perfect for summer!  So this is kind of what you can expect, with regards to Snoh. You walk in, and up along the wall there's a menu. You pick what flavor of Snoh you want, and then you can pick toppings. There are solid ones, and liquid flavor ones as well. Then you wait for them to make it. They'll call your name and you come up to collect your very own Snoh concoction!   For example, the first time I went to Snoh I picked a mango flavored Snoh, with red bean and mochi toppings, and condensed milk on top. The last time I went with my husband we got a thai iced tea Snoh, with cinnamon toast crunch and mochi, and a condensed milk topping. Pretty straightforward. As a heads up, the size of what you get will dictate how many toppings you get, though I'm sure you could get more toppings and pay for that as well. We got regulars both times, which will give you two toppings and one liquid one. It's pretty huge, more than enough to share between two people.   It really is mindblowing. It's so fluffy and ephmeral. It's not dense, not in the least bit, and you'll find yourself going through this enormous bowl quite easily. As new as this business is, when we went in this Saturday evening it was PACKED. Packed enough that we weren't able to get seating, and we just decided to take this home and eat it along the way. Clearly popular. You will get cravings for Snoh, just so you know. Yes, yes you will. My girlfriend who lives in the bay area came to visit, and she regularly gets cravings of Snoh.  So go check it out. You won't regret it.

This is the best place to get snow in the Phoenix area.  The overall quality is comparable (but not as good) as snow places in Cali.  The selection of snow flavors and toppings is decent, and the texture of the snow is good.  The atmosphere is nice, they always have Netflix playing on the TVs and really awesome artwork (for sale) on the walls.  My only complaint is that on a few occasions, the service has been sub-par.  Mainly, the cashier who took my order was unfriendly and rude.  Still, if you're craving snow-- this is the place to go.
This place is awesome! Amazing flavors, great service. Went out of my way to come again before heading back to CA
Snoh!!!! Is the best drink spot in town. Conveniently located and always has fast, friendly service. The strawberry slush is a must try!

This place NEVER disappoints! If you've never had SNOH, you HAVE TO! Is it ice cream? Is it a snow cone? Is it shaved ice? Yes to all of the above... it's a little bit of each , in a wonderfully different way, and a party in your mouth.  What are you waiting for?

Very cool place,  great atmosphere.  The drinks are great and the service was really good as well,  they don't skimp on the Boba which was a huge plus.  They had a few party games like Jenga and Simon says which made this place above the rest. My only complaint it that our table needed to be wiped down.

So many things to love about Snoh. First off, I really enjoy the modern decorations and paintings. The interior feels so different from everything else in Arizona - hipster and modern. There are even board games and cards to entertain yourself with. Along the lines of modernity, Snoh seems to always be experimenting with new creations and recipes. The first time I came they only had milk tea and shaved ice. 3 months later they had brick toast and now they have another new dessert. Innovation and a growing menu are always a plus for my taste palate.   Five stars for the milk tea! In my opinion - best milk tea in Arizona! It has enough sweetness without tasting like syrup! The portions are also great for the price. They even have a stamp card for all milk tea addicts out there.  I always drop by Snoh if I'm in Phoenix and it has happily satisfied my cravings everytime!

First time at this place and I'm definitely coming back...it was DELICIOUS!!!... and their employees Lorenia, Hector and Chris are very friendly and make you feel welcome...kuddos to you guys for the excellent customer service!!
I've been here multiple times and have been impressed each time. The number of ice flavors and toppings seems to keep expanding.
Very good!  I go to the vape shop next door alot and always wanted to come in here. I was not disappointed at all, the ice-cream is super yummy and the place is clean and up beat!
Simply amazing!  Love it. Great Customer Service, friendly Staff. Snoh is the best stuff in Phoenix.
Best ice treat in phoenix area I got the tora shaved ice and it was amazing I recommend  It highly
Such a great dessert spot! I highly recommend the breakfast bowl it's bomb.com. My wife and I love coming here with the kids. The staff is always friendly.
Great central location. Cool vibe and decor. Always a great time here. Fast service and quality ingredients. Staff is professional and helpful. Great way to beat the AZ heat.

Snoh is my absolute favorite place to go for dessert. It's a little out of the way from where  I live, but I will always happily make the trip  for a Taiwanese ice fix. Now that I think about it, it's kind of an addiction. Snoh is a nice combination between shaved ice and ice cream. It's not too heavy on the stomach so it doesn't leave you feeling sick if you eat so much.    I always get Taro snoh with almond pudding(lots of it) and maybe lychee jelly. No glaze for me! I personally think the glaze takes away from the lovely light flavor of the dessert. My second favorite snoh flavor is honey dew it has a lot of flavor. What is also nice about this place is even though it is a small establishment and it can get quite busy at times is the staff is always very friendly.   All in all, great service, great desserts with great flavor. I absolutely can't wait for Phoenix to warm up so I can have my snoh and not shiver while I savor every bite.

Visited this place for the first time a few months ago. Very disappointed to say the least. My wife and kids didn't like it either. To add insult to injury, my snoh had a hair in it. When my wife took it back to the counter the employee told her "oh sorry".
Excellent staff! Came in upon closing and they were happy to help us still!! The shaved ice is the best all around
Finally good boba in Phx!
the people there are really friendly. one of the employees there remember me from like a month ago since my last visit and that to be means customers are more important

I adore this dessert eatery!  The desserts are delicious - so far I have tried the taro snoh and the honeydew snoh and they are both amazing. The shaved ice is fluffy and flavoursome and the servings are really generous and reasonably priced.  The shop is clean and modern, with cute and trendy wall art. They play great music, but it is not too loud. I'd recommend this place for young people going out on a date, because you can chat because it's not too loud, it's reasonably priced and since the snoh ice is so big, you can share!

DAMN.... this is good stuff. Found this place on Yelp after a tasty Thai dinner. The place is decorated super cool with Asian inspired art and anime drawings. I had the #11 breakfast bowl snoh,..... dudes...it's got fruity pebbles in it....BAM. I dig the vibe in this shop and I wish them much success. I wish we had one of these in Los Angeles.

Delicious, unique dessert that will satisfy your sweet tooth without the overstuffed, heavy feeling after! Great flavors, toppings, sauces, and always excellent customer service. They also offer boba tea which is fantastic with almond milk. Snoh has become one of my favorite local spots!

Absolutely love this place! It brings back memories of visiting California every summer and now I can get delicious shaved ice here in my hometown. And the owner is an ice cold dude. Get it? Because he's cooler than cool. Haha

I can no longer endorse this place based on the cocky rude attitude of the owner. I was an early fan and introduced many friends to this place and went often. Now I am the biggest non-fan!  I noticed the owner's attitude changed after his business became successful. He went from friendly and welcoming to being outright rude!   A few examples: 1) My friend found Saran Wrap in her shaved ice and brought it to the owner's attention. She said he dismissed her and said "it happens." She stopped going there after that, but I continued to go, thinking it was an isolated incident (like an idiot!). 2) I noticed that the owner's attitude started being more cocky and less friendly but I kept going (like an idiot!), until the last incident. I ordered condensed milk and double almond pudding as my topping. I noticed that I didn't get any condensed milk and very little almond pudding, so I asked the owner of e added the milk and if the pudding was doubled. He admitted to forgetting the milk and with an attitude squirted so much milk into my dessert the shaved ice melted and there was over an inch of milk left in my cup when I ate what was left of the unmelted shaved ice and pudding. On several prior visits, they forgot to double the almond pudding, so I asked if I got double and he said with an attitude with his back to me... "If you want more let me know," and before I could respond and while he still had his back to me, he slopped on an excessive amount of pudding. My dessert was destroyed. I will never go back again!!!

Tried this place while visiting Arizona for the time. Love it! The prices are really reasonable for a cute little dessert place! We got taro along with condensed milk and strawberries and mango on the side.
So soft, so tasty, almost better than Waiola in Honolulu, but Matsumoto's is still No.1!

I love this place, and im going to miss it when im no longer living in town. I've never had any dessert like Snoh, likely because there really aren't a lot of places like it in Phoenix (if there are, let me know! I would love to compare!). The atmosphere is very hipster-trendy, and it can sometimes get distracting to see all the artwork on the walls and various shows on the two lcd screens. Whenever the couch is open, I make a beeline for it.  With the recent addition of combos, you no longer have to worry about what flavors will taste best with each other. Even still, I know what i like and will either stick to Gotcha Matcha (or some variant thereof) and Thai Chew. Ive also discovered another favorite, which consists of Milk cream snoh, oreo cookie topppings and condensed milk glaze. It's delicious. I can't recommend mochi balls enough. One day i will have to try the fruit mixes, when im not jonesing for my regular Snoh fix.  The teas are also delicious (haven't had a smoothie yet so i cant say anything!) and boba goes well with just about anything. If you're looking for a traditional classic, thai tea or vietnamese coffee pairs well with boba. Personally im a fan of the Green Apple and Honeydew teas.  It's funny, actually. The first time i came here, the boba was tasteless and I wondered what all the fuss was about with bubble tea and why everyone loved it so much. I'm glad I gave this place a second chance, because otherwise I never would have found my favorite dessert joint.

Ahhhhhhhhh, yes. Finally a little piece of California. The vibe here is very much like the shaved ice shops in SoCal and the owners are from there so it warmed my heart tremendously.   I ordered a small Green Tea shaved ice with Almond Cookies and condensed milk drizzle. Our in-laws ordered a small Original with strawberries and condensed milk drizzle and a small Taro with Oreos and condensed milk drizzle.   All were very good, especially the Taro, but even though it couldn't quite compare to SoCal, I'm just so happy to be able to hit this spot up whenever I yearn for a piece of home. Can't wait to come back!

The offerings here are good and most of the staff are cool but there's one dude who is just too cool for school and has messed up my order the last 2 visits and he is a little rude so it kind of sours the whole experience. Other than that this place is all right.
Love their tea's unique place. Server was a little disappointing he made me feel uncomfortable about wanting extra Nutella. Hey it's my sweet treat for a reason I like sugar today!!!!

This place is the best place ever!! Trying to get all our friends hooked! Tony and his staff are so friendly!! If you're going to share with your friends, best thing to do is to share a large snoh (you won't regret it)!! We got it to go once and it has a 20minute span so make sure to keep your car cold and your not going too far! They do an awesome job here! Will be coming back here a lot more knowing it's here!

Really missing California right now and Snoh is helping me get my Blockheads fix in Arizona. Got the taro and green tea shaved ice with mochi, red bean, and condensed milk. Pretty good, not overly sweet, however there was a bit too much condensed milk for my liking. It made the ice hard to pick up cause of the sticky goo.

Fun! Great food! Helpful service. The portion sizes are enormous. Can't wait to return and try several more combinations of snoh and toppings. The drinks look amaxing as well, though I did not order one on my first trip.

Clean Tea shop with shaved milk ice, and lots of cool art/decor.  After having a huge dinner we decided to share a large Snoh combo.  Taro and coconut shave milk, with mango, mochi, coconut jelly, topped with black sesame/condensed milk.  For the price it's pretty good considering we were able to share it with 6 people!  The dessert is very light, not to sweet, and the toppings complimented out milk flavors nicely.  If I had more room, would have tried the teas too.    Check out the deco while you wait, the turn around was only about 5 minutes, luckily we were the first in line.  Great place to snack on any hot, or cold day - if that exist in PHX.

WOWZA!! Try this place ASAP! Too good to pass up, especially on those hot summer days. I love the Thai Chew, all the different ingredients taste amazing together! If i'm ever on that side I always make a stop for snoh, Thai tea or the iced coffee. I will definitely be back again...and again :)

Loved it! Shaved ice, crumbled Oreos, and caramel sauce? Heck yes!   We came out for the Whistl, iPhone app party, and enjoyed trying shaved ice for the first time! I will say, though, that I thought the toppings were lacking. I could have used a few more chunks of Oreos ;)

still my favorite shaved ice place because it's just so different then anyone else and I love bobs as it is now I can get shave bobs and add differs fruit and glaze to it I like all of the flavors so far normally I go to Blossom next door to get my noodles and then for dessert I got here best combo ever if it's your first time get one of the pre set sno on the board you won't go wrong

I absolutely love Snoh! Their Thai tea, Vietnamese iced coffee, and taro milk tea cannot be beat. Their boba is some of the best I've ever tasted. I highly recommend ordering the Purple Fusion shaved ice concoction as well...taro, pudding, cookies, oh my! The employees always have wonderful customer service both at this location and at their downtown location. Give this place a try, you won't regret it!

Delicious! Don't miss out! The shaved ice was very light and fluffy. It tasted like heaven! Haha I usually get the Thai tea shaved ice with boba and condensed milk for the toppings.  Get there early because the downfall is that the place is small. On busy days you won't be able to find a place to sit.  *Update* So I tired their new brick toasts and it was pretty average. The presentation of both toasts were appealing; however, I personally found the toast to be slightly dry. I had better brick toasts at other places, but overall, it was decent. I prefer the coconut and strawberry toast over the almonds and bananas.

I've been here at least three times and it has always been good.  I stick with the milk flavor.  The mochi, almond cookie, and new custard pudding (flan without the caramel) toppings are all fantastic.  The condensed milk, butterscotch, and caramel glazes are all great too.  If they forget to add something just tell them and they'll quickly add it for you to make it right right.  I appreciate that they are actually trying with their interior, which many local small businesses could learn from.  They should consider wiping down their trash cans and sprucing up the game shelf more often though.  Overall, they offer a unique, quality product in a convenient location.  The lightness of the "snoh" somewhat reminds me of true Hawaiian shaved ice.  I'll be back.

When I say their shave ice is nothing like you've EVER had before. It's like shave ice and ice cream had a baby!!!!! I normally get their milk n cream flavored snoh layered with sweetened condensed milk topped with custard pudding. It's AMAZING!!!! I will say my only complaint is they used to offer green tea mochi and just recently stopped serving it. Now I'm a huge mochi lover and the green tea mochi was AMAZING!!!!!! PLEASE BRING IT BACK!!!!!! Atmosphere is great perfect chill spot.

Shaved ice. Shouldn't be too hard - but this place just misses. It is indeed like snow - feathery snow. I like my shaved ice a bit more icy and crunchy - this was too soft and dry. Flavor - coconut was meh. Wasn't impressed. Lots of people - service was slow.

Who knew that you could get really good Asian style shaved ice in Phoenix. It's not like the thick and creamy Taiwanese shaved ice I'm used to from Cupertino, so I would say it seems to be more of a mix between Korean and Taiwanese style shaved ice. Regardless, it was really really really good. Good portions and prices (a regular is hugeeeeeeee and in SF, CA, it would probably cost ~$10+). I loved my milk cream with strawberries and condensed milk! Free wifi!
Yummmmm!!! Such a fun place.  Unique dessert concept!  I wish they would open one up in Scottsdale:)
Every time I'm on that side of town, I ALWAYS go to snoh! Staff is friendly and it's a really nice place to hang out. I usually see a lot of families in there. Also the desserts are flippin awesome.

Stopped by after dinner last weekend at the noodle cafe next door. None of us were really sure what it was and we still weren't after we had it but ate it all.  Large servings so four of us shared two smalls. These are not your usual shaved ices since they have dairy in them. A couple of dairy free options available are made with dairy free creamer?  Lots of toppings and interesting ones to choose from.

The Thai tea snoh is delicious, as usual, by I wonder if these guys are going under...?  The bathroom has been out of order the last three times we have been (which isn't that frequently), and they were out of several common flavors and toppings today. It was also quite warm in the shop--ironic in a place called Snoh! Edited:  Appreciate the reply, Tony!  Glad to hear that you aren't going anywhere and that we just caught you on a bad day!  Our last visit was lovely--restrooms in order, nice and cool in the shop, plenty of mochi...  ;-)  You lose a star for not getting the green tea mochi back, but we love you guys!
Snow is delicious! They have many great flavors and toppings. My favorite is honey dew with condensed milk, boba and Oreos !

After a friend of mine went there that morning and said it was good, I had to go try it for myself.  All four of us had different flavors and toppings, we were all very impress with it.  The place is hip and the servers very friendly.  I'm ready to go back for more, wish they were closer to where I live.   Def will be going back soon.
Almond slushy with boba custard and caramel glaze! The best!           Love it! Everyone is nice and have patience with all my questions

One of the better boba shops in town! Great flavors, and variety, of drinks paired with well-cooked boba. For those wondering, boba is a type of tapioca (a starch) and adding boba to a drink was made popular in Taiwan. Have ordered the Thai tea here and will have to return to explore the menu some more. I do find that their prices are a smidge high, though the size of the drink is pretty large and the quality and taste of their product makes it feel worth it.
LOVED the atmosphere. Strawberry Snoh was great. Mochi topping was delicious! Would go again.

I love snoh cause there's not a lot of places out here like it. My favorite is milk snoh with mochi balls strawberries and condensed milk. Gotcha matcha is really good as well. I still have a lot of stuff I haven't tried yet that I need to but overall everything I've had so far has been super good.

I don't know what they do to that ice but it is yummy. wish the people had a little more time to explain to you what stuff was it's a little confusing and it can be intimidating to try and order so some kind of helpful hints would be nice and seriously please don't be so condescending when I'm trying to place an order I'm mostly confused when I'm looking at your menu. So two reasons I'm only giving 3 stars is the confusing menu and the parking is terrible sometimes. but what I have ordered I really enjoyed and will continue trying to figure it out.

Super excited to finally try this place. I have been to Asia and had the shaved ice there. This is different but in a totally delicious way. Coming inside you are surrounded by video game and comic book art. They even have a snoh mascot sticker.  The choices can be overwhelming for a first timer. They serve snoh, slushies, and tea with several choices for both. You can create your own snoh or choose one of their combos for a small, medium or large size. I think getting a combo is more bang for your buck. I got the secret stash which is pistachio with almonds, custard and caramel. I loved it!!! My sister got the Thai chew which had boba, Mochi and black sesame sauce. It tasted just like a Thai tea drink. When the snoh melts it almost becomes more creamy than fluffy. Definitely coming back!!

Since this place is pretty far from where I live, I usually end up craving one of two flavors every time I visit. I usually bring a friend with me and the workers here are patient and helpful whenever either my friends or I have a question. Its also nice that they're friendly and smile back when you smile.  The vibe in this place is pretty cool and the collected art on the walls is a unique touch. It makes me want to bring some of my own art for them to have there :)  Anyway, I usually like to get taro snow with strawberries and condensed milk. My friends and I have yet to be disappointed by anything we've gotten at this location. The only downside is the parking for this little area. If you're going to come here during busy times, be prepared to make a few circles in order to find a parking spot. Otherwise though, its always been a nice experience visiting Snoh!
A must try if you're in the area! The flavors are rich.  Unlike other places where it might taste watered down.  Good little space for hanging out with friends as well!

The best shaved ice ever.  It has the consistency of snow.  Very popular in the Asian community.  The toppings sound gross, but are awesome.  Have to get the condensed milk. Condensed milk on ice sounds gross, but it is so good.

well this is a first for me to actually give my review of all things...Shaved ICE.  this is no normal shaved ice.. Im not sure the trade secret but I do believe that the flavors are incorporated into the actual ice when frozen..  Like the other Review stated...NO sticky stuff but do get lots of napkins.....no nasty sticky residue on your cup ha...I love it.. and you a choice of toppings...  I usually get Taro with Almonds, almond pudding and condensed milk and its awesome...unlike any shaved ice Ive had in the past... Oh yes its an indoor eating place not outside like all the other temp places Ive seen popping up.  they have tvs and will accommodate your show if possible.  and they have free wifi with a few electrical outlets to use as well.  want to bring the kids...great they have little books and they have little games including Jenga, dominos etc..    want some lively art off the wall? yup they will oblige and sell you a print LOL    I really is an awesome place.  you may want to check em out when you are ion the area.  I was impressed but that is my judgment...you be the judge  its clean including the restroom...its got some great friendly people Ive met at the counter.  small little strip center with  pretty decent noodl;e shop next.  So next time your at oreganos on camelback....pass on the pizza cookie and go next door to the SNOH Ice shavery...

This place is awesome! The menu has a great variety of ice creams (snoh), milk teas, iced teas, etc. And the best part is you can customize your order exactly how you like it. There is a great variety in toppings and flavors for all their products I had the almond milk tea and custard pudding which was delicious! The milk tea itself wasn't too sweet and I felt the custard added the needed sweetest for the perfect balance. The almond pudding is great too! If you ask, they will usually let you sample before you make a selection. I loved that the prices are reasonable for the size beverage you get. The snoh is unique, it's neither ice cream nor shaved ice...it's almost like shaved milk. Has a great consistency and lots of flavors to choose from.   Pros: good pricing great selection awesome product friendly staff  cons:  its far from my house, wish there was a joint in Ahwatukee Hoping for a better point system than the one on FiveStars

I have to say OMG DELICIOUS!  I am love frozen yogurt, so I wasn't sure what to expect from this kind of ice cream.  It is light, flavorful and delicious. I shared my ice cream with my date and I wish I would have gotten my own! I had the taro flavor with condensed milk.  That topping is a must!  When I'm in the area, I will be back here.

After gorging myself out and going H.A.M. on a huge bowl of noodles and bread sticks in front of my date (our second date) at Cherry Blossom next door, we decided to venture over to Snoh. The shaved ice at Snoh reminded me the time when I was an obese kid eating shaved ice in the slums of Taiwan. The shaved ice texture was very unique and fluffy from what you'd imagine. They had all the sweet and fruity toppings you could want. The atmosphere was very is very fun, hip, and clean. Apparently the owner knew we both were on a date so he played some romantic music. Thanks!   Song request for next time: Careless Whisper by George Michael.

Loved this place. I ordered the Taro with condensed milk and fresh strawberries. It was too die for. Definitely want to come back to try everything at least once on their menu. The decoration inside was nice. Lots of artwork, big screen TV's featuring some sort of Asian movie, local business cards. I met the owner as he was taking orders & he was kind and friendly. The atmosphere is more hipsterish than I what I like, but the shaved ice here is so delicious that it definitely doesn't even matter. Highly recommend this place to everyone.
Not really my cup of tea, but the overall experience was good. You get what you pay for, and its not nasty crap. More variety and options would be nice.

Never have had anything like it.  Unique and  best ever.  The shaved ice is very light very similar to fresh snow powder so don't feel overly guilty when indulging for dessert.  The milk teas are awesome as well!  I love it and am addicted.

Love seeing the art in this place and the atmosphere is pretty chill.  Even though they are mainly knowed for their shave ice, I usually go get boba here mainly for their house special.  Their house special drink is a unique blend they mixed up, it's a mix of milk tea with some other tea flavor which makes it sweet but not too sweet.

This place is so good.  Very excited to find a cool place like this for families and that its dairy free friendly.  The customer service was awesome.  Definitely coming back.  We had fun with the games here while we enjoyed our Snoh.

Got a simple strawberry slushie. You could tell there was actual strawberry in it. The wait time was not bad at all either. It was a perfect way to cool off from the crazy Arizona heat. Definitely planning on going back to try the signature sno.

Cute little place that reminded me a lot of a Boba house. The second you walk in you can smell the honey and pearls. The shave ice is pretty on par with a lot of the shaveries in California. Light, chewy, cold, flavorful...some words to describe the eating experience. The workers were helpful and friendly. I didn't know what to order so the guy helping me recommended some toppings for the taro and black sesame ice I ordered. I ended up getting crushed almond cookies with a condensed milk drizzle.   I wish they would have had more ice flavors to choose from but am happy they shaved the ice the way it's supposed to be done. Parking is free and easy and the service is fast. I'd say this is a cool place to chill on a hot day...which apparently is every day in Phoenix :)

I don't even know where to start with Snoh, but somehow the word AMAZING comes to mind.  The d√©cor is modern with unique artwork, the staff is friendly and how do I explain their creations? Unique, Out of this World, Crazy, Fun, Irresistible, Addicting!  Guess the best way to describe Snoh is - A Must Try for yourself to know what I'm talking about.  Tip: TRY EVERYTHING!!

Love love love this place!! I frequently drive all the way from old town Scottsdale just to come here!! I'm totally addictied to their boba tea and I've only tried the snow once but it was super good. My only complaint is that the texture of the boba is never the same. The first time I came here it was super hard and tonight it was super mushy, but other times it's perfect which keeps me coming back for more lol. Other than that this place is amazing!!
Great place too chill with Boba tea, or be quick and run back to the car. Awesome service and even better snow and tea!

Went here recently. It's very yummy. A short story, a couple of years ago we saw a Food network special about this kind of "shaved ice" and was craving it. Eventually we got some in LA and it was everything we wanted.  Jump back to a couple of days ago, my sister said we have to go there. Get the Thai Tea, shaved ice. That flavor is really good. I then tried the milk Thai Tea with lychee jelly. It was surprisingly good.  This store is a little small, so if there are a lot of people in there it gets really packed.     It is $6.75 for a large, perfect to share. Try this, you can thank me later.

Neat place and the shaved ice is good. Different than anything I've had before but it is good. I've had several flavors and the best so far has been Thai Tea shaved ice, Almond Cookie topping, and Condensed Milk glaze.  Took my wife and daughter and everyone really liked it. Highly recommended.

Here's a tip for the staff behind the counter who wait on customers: please be patient with those who have no idea what to order. Don't give a heavy sigh, look irritated or give customers a feeling that you're bothering them...umm...how about offering suggestions to customers on what is popular? Or helping them out in figuring out what they would like? The Owner of this place should focus training their staff on providing customer service with a smile. The 4 stars is for the cute seating area, music selection and for the yummy snoh flavors, toppings and glaze options! Service is more like 1-2 stars.

Can't ever get enough! I have come here so many times. The atmosphere is hip and I love the art on the walls. Will I come back? Yes! I always order the taro with boba and condensed milk. I find it so hard to try other flavors! The brick toast is also really good. Super decadent and perfectly sweet. I'm so glad this place exists!

I really liked the vibe of the place. Walking in you're greeted by the crazy artwork hanging on the wall, burning candles and setting just felt a very chill atmosphere. I got a Thai Tea with boba and custard, and my friend got Almond Milk Tea with boba, and we thought it was good because it wasn't too sweet and everything tasted fine. Pricing was a little much, but besides that everything was great.
Snoh is delicious and they have great boba! Only thing I don't like is location, but dessert and service is awesome! If you like Thai tea then you have to try it as snoh.

This place has pretty interesting treats. I got the pistachio flavored ice and it was delicious. It's almost like eating flavored snow and there is no other way to describe this. Also they offer dairy free options and that's always a plus for me when it comes to desserts. This place has a really cool vibe to it as well. The place is super clean, has friendly service and easy parking access.

I've looked at Snoh Ice Shavery multiple times on Yelp and each time, the pictures had confused me. Thai tea snoh? Taro? Mochi balls? I could go on and on about the things I don't know about. We were in the area for dinner at another restaurant that I couldn't pass up the opportunity to go here.  When we first walked in, I really liked the vibe of this place. It was somewhat busy but still a table or two open and people were just hanging out, enjoying their desserts; it felt like the perfect place to go on a date night or with a friend. After looking over the menu, I decided on the small Thai tea snoh with almond pudding and condensed milk. My date got the mango snoh with strawberries and condensed milk. It didn't take very long for us to get our desserts and after the first bite of the Thai tea snoh, I was satisfied. There were so many ways to describe it, but mostly it was light and fluffy, not as sweet as I expected it to be like Thai tea drinks usually are.  I was a little bit disappointed with my choice of almond pudding. It was a bit too mushy to go along with the texture of the snoh. I'd probably get almond slices or something crunchy in the future. My date wasn't too big of a fan of his choice. I gave it a try and felt that it was too artificial tasting and was lacking something. I'd say that if I was in the area, I'd think about stopping by but I definitely wouldn't go out of my way.
The drink was very good. decoration of the front is very cute. However, customer survive is not quite good, I don't know what his name and he is not friendly AT ALL!!!!

Best boba and shaved snow spot in phoenix! They have two non dairy snow flavors, and some daily specials, too. My friend convinced me to get their 32oz Mason jar for $3 fill ups on Mondays. Such a good deal for a boba-holic, and I've been filling it with water on my off days for a hydration win. Parking can be so bad here so just a heads up! Sign up for their rewards thingy for a free topping!

Yea had this for the first time last weekend it's just AWESOME...had the Mango with Kiwi, Almond Cookies and Condensed Milk . Staff was super nice and offered help with my choices. Just go and beat the heat with this cool goodness!

Ummmm this is the best stuff I have ever tried. I get the taro snoh with almond pudding and condensed milk. Just for the record, I'm russian and had no idea what taro and almond pudding were until I randomly tried it here. The combination is heavenly. Oh, and get the stamp card because you will be back for more, trust me.
One of my favorite dessert spots, I love having taro snoh with black sesame glaze, boba & custurd pudding. Perfect treat during the summer heat!

This place is trendy as !@#$. The decor and art on the walls make me think of Roosevelt and 5th only safer, this isn't far from the Biltmore after all. Snow is the perfect summer treat.  Here you pick your flavor snow, add toppings, and sauce.  I go for green tea snow, mochi, and condensed milk.  My friend got the taro and was very pleased.  They also have boba smoothies and it looks like they're getting into the habit of switching out seasonal flavors.

We really wanted to try this place last night..I  finally found a parking spot go inside and wow  the line ..I only had 15 minutes and it wasn't moving. Had to leave so think king of trying it again but not on a Friday night.

This place has amazing teas!  Get their mason jar to get a better deal and more tea!   I like the shave ice.... but I can't seem to find my favorite/perfect combination.  This place is super busy, especially on weekends and after work.  Plan to wait in line and get cozy with some strangers while you wait for them to call your name.
Accurately charged for my snoh orders this time around from the guy at the cash register. Friendly. Enjoyed a cool  treat for the summer time heat! Will be back again.

So happy that the frozen yogurt craze is dying down.  Snoh is a nice addition to the AZ frozen dairy/dessert scene. It was just before noon in August and blistering hot. My friend and I as well as two large parties awkwardly peered through their windows to find ready but bored teenage employees unapologetically staring at us as we sweated in the sun. It would have been a nice gesture to open  30 seconds earlier than official opening time knowing that 10 people (including two very elderly people) were waiting outside.   The green tea snoh was a light, fluffy, and tiny bit grainy. Unique and enjoyable. My friend's snoh was also tasty and a bit more sweet than mine.  Service could have been a lot better. Would it kill those kids to throw on a fake smile every once in a while? They look so sad.

This place is great! Although they don't always have boba, the desserts are delicious! It's a cross between ice cream and shaved ice and the flavors are out of this world! I would recommend to anyone and will go back again!
We love this place and are already planning our next treat choices. Great atmosphere! We played Jenga with our kiddos and just relaxed.

If you like tasty cold treats, you must check out Snoh!  I don't say "ice cream" or "shaved ice" because it really isn't either of those things like I think of it. And if a few friends hadn't raved about the place I doubt I would have checked it out. Shaved ice didn't sound that exciting. Don't make that mistake - this place is great!  I had the shaved thai tea, almond cookie topping, and black sesame glaze. I had no idea what I was ordering, so asked the super friendly guy at the counter (Tony) for advice. It was nice, light, and super tasty. My wife had the taro, shaved almonds, and caramel glaze. Hers was more savory than mine, but both were delicious.  The place also has a great vibe. Super clean, with some slick art on the walls. A TV was playing a dubbed asian war movie of some kind that was fun to watch. They also have games on one of the tables up front to keep kids (and adults) entertained.  If it sounds interesting but you're not sure what some of these flavors are like (taro?), don't let that stop you. The staff was great and can help you put together something nice and safe or crazy and adventurous. Either way it is seriously refreshing on a hot Phoenix day.  This is one of our new favorite dessert places in town. Get in there and try it out!

I love their strawberry lychee iced tea with boba and lychee jelly! So good! Me and my friend has been coming here every Thursday for thirsty Thursdays... buy one get one half off! I am so happy we found a place in Phoenix that has good boba... there is not many places that are good, but this is one of them!

OMG this place is great.  I ordered the green tea ice with mochi and sweet sesame.  I love it.  One of my girls ordered regular with oreos and caramel...yummy.  The added bonus is the local artwork you can buy.  My family and I will get every chance to visit again.
Best dessert shop in the Phoenix area by far. Something unique and delicious. I always refer anyone from in town and out to try this place out!

This is probably the best boba place in all of Central Phoenix that I am personally aware of. They occasionally do Groupon specials so you can nab some discounted drinks through that app on your phone.  Flavors are plentiful, go to their website, the menu is extensive!  One thing I want to caution though, if you're not a fan of excess amounts of sugar, Snoh Ice Shavery DOES offer a "half sweet" option for most of their milk tea drinks with the exception of their "house blend" (house blend is just tea, that's why there's no option to make half sweet because it's not sweet to begin with). Anyway, some of us like the half sweet option so our insulin levels don't get all wonky in our bodies.  Check Google before you go to see how busy they are in the current hour, because when this place gets packed, it is PACKED.  Finally, the art factor: The art is dope as fuck. Check out some of my photos that I've added of this place, there is some crazy cool art on the walls here. Long time ago, people could draw on the wall themselves, but the business decided to remove that aspect, probably because of the maintenance costs that were associated with it.  Come to Snoh Ice Shavery sometime! It's a great hiding spot especially during hot Phoenix summers.

Super tasty!!  I'm so excited that another asian place opened up in Phoenix--usually you'd see something like this in Chandler...but I'm so stoked that it's in my hood!  I tried the taro with almond pudding and sesame topping.  Mmmmm...delicious!  It's hot in Arizona, go get some SNOH!

Love it!!! First tasted it at the Matsuri festival and was blown away. I haven't strayed to much from from my original selection although I swear every time I go I will try something new the taro flavor always gets to me. I love the taro with condensed milk and mochi.

We try to scrounge up shaved ice places all across the nation because we love shaved ice especially the old Taiwanese style kind that's so hard to find these days unless you are in Houston because more fusiony modern ice is popping up everywhere. We usually don't perfer this kind and have tried it in our hometown and elsewhere BUT so glad we found this particular place. Read the reviews, was near where we had dinner and gave it a shot. I was so excited to bring my fam here because it's not easy to find a good shaved ice eatery especially with funky flavors like sesame and taro.  That's what we got. Yes it seems a bit much at $8 but you get to pick two flavors of ice and two toppings. Of course I got mochi n boba. Yes I did wish they gave us more mochis n bobas but the large sized  dessert was decently sized (idk if it's the same to-go), totally shareable with the kids although I would have enjoyed it more just with my husband n I :) Kids didn't like the sesame yes it's an acquired Asian taste but they devoured the taro and condensed milk n my toppings :/ we need Snoh in Austin!   My daughter got pistachio milk tea and man was it yummy! Non dairy too :)   Cute lil place with games to play, picture wall with props and clean bathrooms. Nice guys working there who told us to come back up to get more condensed milk topping halfway through. Who does that?  Definitely will go back if we are in town n wish we have one back home :( would go here daily vs Monster Ice here :/   Definitely would recommend a try and not to expect it to be like the typical shaved ice or snocone you get. Its different not meant to be pebbly but funkier, grittier, n silkier. Fun ;)

I was never much into shaved ice, but this place...let's just say I am addicted. I can't get enough.   The ambiance is great with a hip decore and nice art.  It has great location. The service is super good and fast.   I mostly order mango flavor with nutella. They have great selection of topings to choose from. Many different combos and trust me, you can not go wrong.   I am looking forward to my next visit....
Snoh is amazing. The Thai ice tea flavor is my favorite and the service is always great. Super yum! Totally recommend.

Everything is good. Everything. So refreshing!  My wife and I moved away from Phx just as Snoh was getting big, and wow do we miss it. We recently came back from Philadelphia and drove out to Phx from the East Valley just to eat at Snoh. It is truly better than any Snoh I had in Taiwan -- they know what they're doing! We would gladly fly back just to eat Snoh again. Keep up the good work guys.

I was actually very excited to try this place out. So we've been there twice now, and it's always been very busy both times. I feel like the people behind the counter are not helpful AT ALL. I've asked questions both times that I've gone and I think all the hype has gone to their heads because they come off as very rude people. I would go there more often but I really don't like the vibe in there. Umm, let's see both times we've gone they were out of things we order, and we have to settle for something else. The tables both times we've gone have been sticky and dirty. The windows to the business are also pretty grimey. The boba milk tea I ordered was good but nothing spectacular. I guess if you go I wish you luck that they have what you ask for and that they are happy to serve you.

My girlfriend introduced me to this place and we frequently stop by to grab a cup of their snoh. I almost always order the Purple Fusion because its so good I just never get tired of it and the Vietnamese coffee is really good too! The only complaint I have is that the tables don't seem to get wiped down enough but that isn't a huge problem because we mostly take it to go but the 3-4 times we have had the snoh there we noticed the a lot of the tables are covered in crumbs or sticky stuff.

This place is "eh" at best. If you have been to Taiwan then you will understand. The milk tea is drinkable but no where near authentic. The snow however is good. In addition, I have tried their vietnamese iced coffee. That was no good. Will not order that ever again. Trust me when I say I know the authentic taste of milk tea from Taiwan and the Vietnamese iced coffee from Vietnam. I've been to both countries. Overall, I guess it's alright. I prefer to go elsewhere but, this is still an okay place to go to. Give it a try I guess...

I love Asian desserts and it's hard to find them in AZ. When I'm in Asia I look for Taiwanese and Thai desserts with ice, red bean, condensed milk, mango, tapioca pearls, etc. The owner of snoh told me his technology is from Hong Kong. This place satisfies my Asian dessert needs. My order is the same every time. I get coconut snoh with black sesame glaze topped with red bean! It is so light and the sweetness level is just right. I tell all of my friends and coworkers to visit Snoh when they're in Phoenix. I want the owner to open one in Tucson so badly!

Walked over here after a delightful meal next door at the Noodle Place. B-Day Girl wanted something sweet and tasty. I have never seen a place like this before. Simple menu and some interesting ingredients. Hmmm?  I have always liked Ice Cream, Frozen Yogurt or just a smidgen of that Midwest delicious Custard. This place is a bit different and at the same time a one of a kind experience. More of an Asian twist if I can say so. Nice!  Everyone ordered something different. You pick the size, flavors of the base ingredient, and then what toppings you like. Then you choose a glaze to finish it off. They also sell milk tea and ice teas.  I order a Regular sized Original with Mochi Balls, Almond Pudding covered with Black Sesame Topping. One of the family members ordered something with a Mango and Chocolate combo kinda of thingy going on. I did not ask what the B-Day Girl got but the Granddaughter liked it so much she shot a spoonful across the room onto the wall. Napkin Please.
