All around COOL concept with some interesting flavor combinations. I like the game playing area as well. Just kick back and chill if time permits. Game On!  3.5 Stars

I found this place via yelp and suggested that my out of town family members to try this place with me. If you get a large shaved ice, they can put it on the plate. It looks a lot more presentable for the insta-game. The kind young man at the cashier was kind enough to explain everything to us in great detail. We had a lot of questions too! He seem excited about his job!   We got the matcha ice with mochi and aloe jelly as our topping. The matcha ice and toppings were drizzled with condensed milk yumminess. The ice is soft, smooth, and melts in your mouth. The one of a kind ice in Phoenix is worth trying! I also got the lychee boba tea slush. The boba was better than the first time I had it at Snoh. The lychee flavor was subtle.    4 stars for the boba, 5 stars for the snow!

I would give this place 4.5 stars. I've had better snow shaved ice before at other places, but this is the best snow shaved ice that you are going to get in Arizona. The boba was actually really good and was warm, which my friends and I liked. We got a large green tea and milk cream with strawberries and honey boba. The ice isn't flaky melt in your mouth kind, but it is smoothe. I would recommend coming here. The staff is really nice and they have tables to hang out and chat with friends at. There are TVs and they have some cool decorations on the walls.

I got the jar of passion fruit tea with lychee jellies here and it was so yummy! The staff was so nice. The little girl scooping the jellies into the drink was so adorable. The owner's mom even came over to talk to my friends and I. She was such a sweet lady and really made us feel welcome. I also love the interior of the place, the artwork on the walls were so cool. They just need to open one on the east coast.
Your super friendly neighborhood frozen treat shop. The service is great. The environment is warm and welcoming. These guys were featured on the local news for a reason!

I would give this 100 stars if I could. I have had traditional asian shaved ice before and I am so glad I could find a place in phoenix. I had many people recommend it and it was true to the hype.   The space has great art and games like jenga for people to play.   We ordered taro with mango and condensed milk. The taro is one of the most popular flavors and it is clear why. It's delicious am not too sweet.   The other one we got was Thai tea with mochi and condensed milk. Also delicious, but I preferred the taro.
Regular matchi snow with honey boba,mochi balls, and condensed milk

So glad we found this place!! Every time we come to Phoenix, we will definitely be stopping here! Can't wait to go there again tomorrow! I don't think you could go wrong with any of the menu items.  awesome place! Amazing employees/service too!
Best in PHX for boba tea and snow. Always coming up with new deals and menu items and I love them for that. Please don't leave us ever!

This place is great. Didn't realize this use to be near where we lived previously until we were moving. Location is great, parking is so-so. Staff friendly, but definitely gipped me of my punch card. Some of the staff would only punch my card once, when I had bought maybe 4-5 drinks, when the card clearly reads items, not visits. Still have yet to try the signature "snoh" item, as Im writing based on my experience purchasing their boba drinks. Wish they could blend the drinks instead of just serving over ice. Overall good.

First time here and I love it! The atmosphere is super friendly, they have games available and are very geek welcoming! Prices are good for the amount you get and the taste is wonderful!!!!! No fav for when I am getting a sweet tooth!!!!!

I have to admit this visit (2nd time) was better than my last.  My first visit was less than exciting  which was true bummer because I traveled all the way from Goodyear (with a toddler) to enjoy this tasty treat. When I arrived I asked the gentleman could he help me because I have never been there before, let's just say he did not look happy when I told him I was using Groupon voucher (or maybe because I have septum ring, Lol).  So, this time I took time to study the online menu so I wouldn't upset anyone at the counter.  The snoh is pretty good, the Boba is decent...I will admit, I am little bit bias because I love, love different flavored boba. I have one Groupon left and I will try the bricktoast that looks absolutely scrumptious!!  I just hope my next visit the person at the counter will be as helpful as the young lady was today!

We dropped by here yesterday thinking out would be a fun place to try. The place was very busy, and based on that i was ready for an awesome experience. However, that was not to happen. We ordered a lemon and a peach slushie and paid over $9 for the two. The lemon had no flavor at all! The peach was so so.  I expect a product like that when paying $2 but not $9. Im going to assume they were so busy that they were putting out sub par products. Extremely disappointing experience.

Loved the taro sno with almond cookies, almond pudding and condensed milk! Very cool place, would like to go back and try the brick toast next time. We were there on a Friday night and lots of folks hanging out, playing games, very nice place to relax with a sweet treat!

Been coming here for over a year but yesterday the 11th a Sunday the staff was less than 1 star !!!!! They were 4 of them but when we came in it took them over 5 minutes to get out front ! Then they all looked more miserable than angry cat ! Smiles are definitely not part of this crew they and oh forget the customer service , their crappy attitude matched the shaved iced they served it looked like they were out just not having it on a Sunday ! My "snoh" looked like dried up play doh and even tasted worst !
my favorite dessert place! :) better than ice cream and froyo put together! and the staff is always really nice and friendly. definitely recommended
Taro with boba. Best dessert ever! Need to go 24/7 cause I'm always craving it. Fun place to go and hang out with friends outside of the bar scene.. it's every big child's dream

The snoh itself (I had taro with almond jelly and condensed milk) is pretty good but their size options are overpriced by about a dollar each. I don't think this was intentional, but I sensed some attitude when I asked if I could mix two flavors - the answer is no for small and regular size. Friend ordered taro milk tea and it was not good. The drink was poorly mixed and the boba were either undercooked or had been sitting out for too long.  Also, when an employee cleaned the table next to ours, he sprayed the table cleaner in such a way that the aerosolized droplets made their way into my open mouth.  Not a pleasant taste or feeling when you are trying to eat.   Overall: come if you've never had asian shaved ice before, but stick to yogurtland for better value and variety.

My Go-To Boba joint in the Valley. In San Diego you come across the bigger joints like Lollicup and Tapioca Express; Snoh in my opinion is up there!! Love the teas and the slushes. My ultimate fav is the lemon-green tea with Boba!  perfect every time. Thirsty-Thursday, two for five tea's and Thai Tea Tuesday, has us comin back for more. The crowds at the establishment are to show for the crave around the valley. Staff are always friendly and familiar faces every time. Fun to sit back and play board games and enjoy the lovely art work displayed across the walls!

This place is hopping.  They were very busy with a lot of choices . Maybe too many . Service was quick we liked their mango  ice with fresh mango and Condensed milk . Best deals are large which you can share with two others  the place is noisy and not a place for conversation
Amazingly friendly service and great green tea shaved ice! Would definitely recommend this cute, quirky place!

Their drinks are so good. The location is great but I live all the way in west valley... This place cannot be compared to other boba in town. Hands down the best place for hangouts, drinking milk tea, ice tea, and deserts. Love their house blend special and mango ice tea!

I love their shaved ice and the variety of different flavors but last time I went in, the cashier was extremely rude, not only to me but to each person that was in line after me & 2 of my friends I was with. We couldn't believe it! Not sure if the person was just having a bad day or what his deal was but no matter what the business is, a customer should not be given attitude or snarky remarks while ordering and asking about their products. As much as I love their shaved ice and flavors it's definitely not worth putting up with that attitude. My friends and I decided we won't be back since there are tons of other places with much friendlier staff :)
I love the variety of the snow flavors that they have. Service is also very nice. I love the almond cookies. Such a good add on.

Taste good but they use powder for all their drinks. I like my tea to be freshly brewed. With all the boba shops, for them to cut costs and be lazy making their boba teas, this place just doesn't compare to other better ones nearby. Their boba texture is good tho.
pretty damn tasty and reasonable priced.....the boba was on point.
AMAZING!!! I had the purple fusion and it was heaven and the brick toast was better than you know what. ;-). I am totally coming back here.

The place is always  busy. But they are  pretty  fast. The shaved ice is light and refreshing.  . There are a lot of choices. Place is clean . Most of the customers  are younger . Portions  are large  and medium order is plenty to share . My favorite  is mango . You might not be able to find parking or a place to sit

Alright, so I visited this place for the first time I went to Phoenix before returning back home to Florida.   First off, I'd like to thank them for their awesome service and accommodation. We arrived a little earlier than opening time as they were setting up & allowed us to sit inside with our puppy as we waited. (YES, they allow pets). It was awesome and made us feel very welcome from the start.  I stumbled across this place thanks to the reviews and photos other yelpers had posted. So when the gentleman at the cashier I explained to him about it being our first time and there was one particular picture that caught my eye & though I did not know what it was, all I had to show him was the picture and he explained what it was and started making it right away.   They give you the choice of size, flavored ice(s), toppings, and sauces. Since I wasn't sure what sauce would taste best (though both were described to me) he surprised me with adding both on my dish. ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!  It was fulfilling, delicious, flavorful, and just enough to cure a sweet tooth craving without an overwhelming taste. I just HAD to share thee picture the moment I saw it & good thing I did, because it was not pretty for long once you dive in.  As I am no longer in the Arizona region, I am already planning my trip to Phoenix again and Snoh is (and forever will be) on my list.

Ordered the coconut shaved ice with strawberry topping and condensed milk drizzle.  Not a fan of coconut normally but this is so light and fluffy it melts in your mouth. You also get a 15% discount for posting a Yelp review. Highly recommended!
I love the milk teas here. I've had their shaved ice and it is good, but I keep coming back for the milk teas. Very yummy!

I spotted this next door to Cherry Blossom, and wanted to know what all of the hype was about as I've never experience "snow" before. My husband and I were pretty full from dinner, so we decided to split a small. We chose the green tea, with mochi, oreos, and caramel drizzle. The snow was unlike anything I've had before, well at least food-wise, because it really was almost like eating snow. It was very light and fluffy and melted as it hit your tongue. The green tea flavor was very good, I like that it was subtle. The toppings added some dimension to the dish with the chewy sweet mochi (kind of like gummy bears) and crunchy oreos. The caramel drizzle was very decadent, and a nice added touch. The girl who checked us out was very helpful and friendly, and offered to give us recommendations if needed, which was nice. I can't wait to come back and try more flavors, or I might even try the boba next time!

Think cold cotton candy ....That is exactly what Snoh is like! It literally melts in  your mouth and is so refreshing. I love that it is light and airy, the perfect not-too-rich, satisfying dessert! I split a small Smorrissey (Chocolate Snoh, Marshmallows, Graham Crackers & Nutella). Seriously heaven. I can't wait to come back and try some of their other combinations! The concept is so unique and will literally send your tastebuds asking for more. (I secretly wished that I had ordered my own and didn't share). ;) This place is a must try!

I love this place. Everything I've ordered has been tasty, the staff is friendly and helpful, and its a nice clean place to relax. I would definitely recommend trying it out if you haven't already. You won't be dissapointed!

Shaved ice dessert.  Ordered the coco loco and the mango loco. Small size. Is plenty big for two people to share.    The coco loco has an okay coconut taste ....... But very dry   For shaved ice I was surprised at how dry it was.   The mango loco had nice fresh chunks of mango on too. The mango flavour failed to carry through to the shaved iced   I loved the caramel sauce on the top. The mango pudding at the bottom was pretty tasteless and rather gelatinous. Did not add anything to the shaved ice concoction   Would suggest trying something with stronger flavour base   Fun vibe

Ignore the reviews that don't rate this place with five stars!!! Amazing staff and amazing treats. The breakfast bowl is my favorite and I can't wait to try more of their items! The whole place is great. Definitely recommend !

Honestly not getting the hype about this place, my friend and I both walked with relatively high expectations from all the other yelp reviews but neither of us felt satisfied.  I ordered the green tea flavor snoh while he had the milk flavor and honestly I must say it just wasn't very good.  Perhaps I'm biased because I just had Blockheads in LA a month or two before but even then my unbiased friend seemed to agree with me that the snoh wasn't even mediocre.  Maybe we just came in on a bad night but I will give props to the customer service and atmosphere.
You do not know what you are missing if you have not been here! A must on your bucket list! Make sure to try a drink along with your snoh, i promise you will regret nothing.

Updated:  Business reach out and actually trying to improve customer experience add 1 star. To neutral review. I'll be willing to try this place again in the future.  ***  Tried once out of curiosity. I asked the teenager behind the counter about one of yhe drink flavor, he cant explain what the flavor taste like. All he said was it sweeter than milk tea. Got the drink come to find out it taste like extra sweet coconut. I hate coconut. I used to served boba, starbucks coffee back in HS/College year. It's part of server job to be able to understand the taste of the beverage you are serving. Even if you dont want to taste the food/drink you should be able to provide some description of the drink more than it is sweet especially when the name of the drink is ambiguous. It's boba drink dude, it's laced with tons of sugar, of course it will be sweet. (-2)  Small place, typical okay deco, nothing spectacular plus the experience I described above...i just dont view this place as 5 star place hence i used 4 star max for review.

I love Snoh! I stumbled upon this place looking for dessert places in Phoenix while on a trip and boy did it not disappoint. As soon as I walked in I love the atmosphere, there is a lot of art all over the walls. Also if you go with a group of people there are board games that you can play while you enjoy your Snoh and/or Milk Tea.  One thing I realized about the menu was all the toppings you are able to put on your Snoh. There are so many choices and flavors and you can even decide what glaze you want. I decided to go with the large size so I can have two flavors, I went with green tea and black sesame with condensed milk as the glaze. For the toppings I have almond cookies, mochi and strawberries. I loved the green tea but I loved the black sesame Snoh even more and it definitely compliments the green tea. The green tea Snoh was sweet while the black sesame had a nutty taste to it. The condensed milk as a glaze pretty much compliments any Snoh and since I was torn between the black sesame and condensed milk, the girl working was nice enough to give me a little sample to try.  They also have brick toast that I didn't get to try but looks super yummy, hopefully I'll be in town soon again so I can. I really wish I had a Snoh Ice place like this closer to me. However if I do go back to Phoenix, I will definitely come back here.

Hmm,  this is definitely not for me.  This dessert is a little bland for an americanized taste.  I guess I have lived here too long and I crave a lot more sweetness.  I agree with Evan, the price and wait is a little much, not worth my time or money.  The desserts look really pretty and that is why I bumped it up a notch, but I will not be coming back.  After eating the top part that had condensed milk and the strawberries, I pretty much left the rest.  I am sure they are not going to miss me anyways.

LOVE IT! I always have shave ice when I'm in China, and it's great to see it finally land here in the Valley.   For those who don't know, many countries and cultures in Asia and across the world have shaved ice desserts. They may range from Filipino halo-halo, to Korean bingsu, and to Chinese bing-sha. Most of them involve finely shaved ice with sweetened condensed milk, fruits, beans, and other toppings.  Snoh takes it one step further by providing flavors of shaved ice! I loved their green tea and taro snoh, especially paired with toppings like mochi and red bean with a glaze of sweetened milk. Highly recommend this place.  The decor is bright and trendy with cool artists displaying their work on the walls. There are TVs on the walls and overall, it's a great place to socialize with friends and just chill.

I'll own up to the fact that when I first heard about this place, the first image that I conjured up was that of snow cones I grew up with during summer and particularly as a snack bar staple of my little league baseball years.  Needless to say I didn't have high expectations nor a whole lot of enthusiasm to try this place.  A friend of mine and his wife came here beforehand and were pretty blown away with what they discovered so they invited me along this time.   The place is set right next door to CherryBlossom on 9th St & Camelback and in fact I think it might be owned by the same family.  Its not a huge space and it was pretty packed here on a Saturday night.  When you walk up to the counter the menu is pretty easily discernible as they lay out the ordering process step by step.  Pick a size, pick a snoh flavor, pick one of their numerous toppings, pick a glaze.  Pretty much like you would do at any ice cream joint.  Not really having any comprehension for what was about to flow my way, I went for broke and went weird on my order.  Medium mango snoh, topped with M&Ms, cinnamon toast crunch and chocolate sauce.  Okay it sounds gross, but I was once substituted Gatorade for milk in my Fruit Loops as a kid.  So I could've done worse, okay?  Took about 5 minutes for them to prepare and cost about $6.  This stuff surprised me in a number of ways.  For starters, snoh is not your all-American snow cone ice, not even close.  Its packed with plenty of flavor and much more closely approximates ice cream.  The other surprise is that I didn't feel uncomfortably full at all after I was done.  The snoh almost seems to mask the actual portions you're being served as the melting effect is very gentle and you don't feel you've actually eaten that much.  Some might call that a scam.  I think it might be a brilliant solution to our obesity epidemic.  The toppings actually complimented the snoh quite well, though admittedly mixing mango and chocolate was probably not my best idea.  All in all, a great value for the price.  The place was pretty clean despite being busy and I walked away satisfied without being uncomfortable.  I can't bring myself to give it 5 stars as I'm still partial to the genuine all-American dense creamy scoop of ice cream.  But snoh is a cool concept that obviously has a following and I'd be more than happy to take in another trip here.  Though you probably should steer clear of the "imaginative" combinations I threw out of left field on my first try.

First off, I'm SOO happy I live walking distance from this place!! New fav lil hangout spot. For my first time, it was cute & hipster. Very clean & their sweets are pretty bomb! Strawberry snoh ice shaving with condensed milk.. YUM! plus my boyfriend and I played a quick round of Jenga while we enjoyed our treat. Very cool concept

Usually we have gone to places near Asian grocery stores but stumbled upon this place via Yelp.  I'm all about the boba (tapioca pearls) so when I had my first milk tea from here, I was happy with the texture and taste of their boba. I haven't tried the shaved ice but from other people's faces, it looked like they enjoyed theirs. In terms of milk teas and boba, it's a pretty good place. Only gave 3 stars because they don't offer varieties in milk tea selection nor do they do blended drinks. The taro milk tea is also a little gritty, maybe not mixed well? But it's still good and so is their Thai tea.
Ordered strawberry and a Honeydew with Mochi Balls. Light, very airy and good. BUT Overpriced for what you actually get. ;(

I love the Taro Boba milk tea. The bobas made just right. Usually its a hit or miss.  You either get them way too mushy or tough. They have beautiful art hanging on the walls and its a cool spot to talk/chill with friends. The joint has board games you can play with while you socialize

Expected the ice to have more flavor. Was very wrong. I recommend you get a ton of of icing and other flavorful toppings. Without them it doesn't taste like anything. Pretty cool little hipster place though.

one word: AMAZING. Pretty soon this will be replacing fro-yo places. $3.75 for a small is pretty decent. I tried 3 different flavors. Taro-Lychee and Black Sesame, Thai Tea-Green Tea Mochi and Black Sesame, Strawberry-Strawberry Mochi, Almond Cookies and Condensed Milk. The best was the Taro. Such a different flavor and flavorful. The Thai tea was good but probably goes better with sweeter flavors. And the strawberry was ok but it wasn't so creamy, it was more icy than creamy.  The place is pretty trendy. and has games to play, sofa and its right next to Cherry Blossom and Oregano's, two of my favorite restaurants. Skip dessert there and come here.

This is a fun experience! Shaved ice like you've never had before. So fluffy just melts in your mouth and the flavors are awesome. Must try coconut with nutella and boba and the taro milk tea with boba is awesome too
Poor quality snoh. Lacking flavor. Got the smores bowl. The place looks cool but the snoh isn't great.

I've been hearing about Snoh for months..."You've GOT to try it!" Well, it's just a couple of doors down from where we got ramen, so...we tried it!  Walked in - cool space - walls are packed with pop-art/comic book art - fun!  Walked to the counter to try to ascertain what we might care to order.  Pretty complicated menu - lots of choices!  First of all, Snoh isn't shave ice, and it isn't ice cream - it's a fusion of the two. Then they have flavors and toppings and etc.  We perused the menu for a while, and everyone sorted out what they wanted. I chose the "Secret Stash" - pistachio flavored, almond slivers, caramel and egg custard. Next, had to choose a size - S - M - L - more realistically L - XL - and "YGBFKM!"   Wow - huge servings!  I went with a small.  The pistachio flavored snoh was good, as were the almonds and the caramel, but...I didn't care for the egg custard - it was almost like nearly hard-boiled egg white - not my thing, but hey, try something different next time.  All in all, a fun stop - but would've been better if we hadn't just finished dinner and were more hungry.  Worth another try.

I love the youthful atmosphere, and plenty of table games so you can spend some time with friends and family. The staff were super friendly and professional. Other than that, The greentea snow that I ordered melted too quickly and it tasted like ice to me more than snow. The boba was well-cook and mochi was decent. Just the overall experience didn't win me over. 3 stars for you, Snoh.

Have you ever eaten a really delicious hearty meal, but there was this lingering desire for something sweet? But at the same time you have no idea how you can fit another bit of anything in to your happy, full belly? Worry not. This is how I felt after finishing my plate next door at Cherry Blossom, we decided we had to give Snoh a shot. I thought I would just take a bite of my husbands Shaved Ice. After that one bite, I knew I had to have my own. Scraping the last bit from the bottom of my bowl, I actually was regretting not getting the biggest bowl they had to offer. It was so light, fluffy, and craving curing, but with out the whole feeling of being miserable. I LOVED IT.   You don't just have to have the shaved ice. They also have Iced Teas, Coffees, Slushies' and Vietnamese Toast. You can chose one of the options from the board that they have carefully created for you. Or you can create your own.   Don't be scared of something different for dessert. You wont regret giving Snoh a try.

So glad I decided to check this place out! So delicious and would definitely recommend! They have so many different options to choose from and the staff was quite friendly.  The only downsides: parking, lack of indoor seating, and 3-4 items on the menu were out :(
Loved it! First time trying something like this. As a newbie I went with Taro/condensed milk/almond cookie. It was delish! I honestly can't wait to try other toppings & flavors.

Okay. I should be doing homework but this place is so good I had to review it. I got their Pistachio Milk Tea! I'm lactose intolerant so when I saw that most of their drinks are dairy free I almost jumped for joy. Most boba places already have milk in their premade milk teas, so I was happy that this place had dairy free items. (I'm guessing they use dairy free creamer)

"If all the snowflakes were candy drops and milkshakes, Oh what a snow it would be. Standing outside with my mouth open wide, Ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah ah."  This child hood song comes to life with snoh. Little tiny snowflakes, Embossed with burst of exotic flavors, Melting into your taste buds magically, As your eyes enjoy a nice does of art pieces on the wall.  I love Snoh. Five Flaky Stars ;-)

Snoh is the ideal retreat from the heat in Phoenix in the summer!  Thai tea is my favorite flavor, with pecans and slivered almonds. A touch of black sesame glaze tops it off. They also have an assortment of iced tea, boba and other tasty shaved ice concoctions.  If you're looking for a a refreshing dessert, stop by. The texture is lighter and more refreshing then ice cream in my humble opinion.

This ice!!! Is the best snoh in all the winter womderland. The owners know how to connect with the young and older crowd. With smart decor simply playful.  Roomy and cool air make this the perfect desert oasis!

I got the mountain of dew and it was amazing! I love cinnamon I love Mountain Dew and that made it such a great combination! It tastes amazing and I would come back for it! It's a great place to hang out with family or friends and play board games

Third time here and it was amazeballs! I tried the green tea again and I think it's a very light green tea. I just wish the taste is stronger but not bad. The pistachio was amazing!! Definitely my favorite place now!
Love love love this place. Super chill vibe, phenomenal customer service, but most importantly, house blend milk tea with boba, TO DIE FOR

Good ice cream.. Good atmosphere.. Never make me disappointed!! I always come here when I have a stress out from school and work.. Their ice cream always make me happy!!  Taaa... Taaaa... Taaaaa.. I am loving it..!!!
Shaved ice dessert.  A quaint joint to grab a refreshing bite.  Lots to choose from and you can have yours custom made as well.

Such an awesome concept!!  The shaved ice is so soft and fluffy and it comes in many different flavors which you can use to make custom snohs or the combo flavors they have on the board.  They have just about any topping you can think of and you can tell the ingredients are of good quality.  The decor is so cute too.   They also have milk teas you can make all kinds of combos with too and thai iced teas.    LOVE this place!  I will be visiting much more frequently!  Pat bing su is my favorite dessert so this is right up my alley!

After pizza, we had to get dessert. This is a small shop that has lots of neat artwork on the walls. Tables fill up fast so you may or may not get seating. Staff here were great.   Green Tea Milk Tea w/ Honey Boba - This did not really taste like green tea. It had a mild cinnamon flavor so it reminded me more of a horchata. The boba was a little firm and chewy. Yes, we compared the boba to Tea Station and it didn't even come close.   The Golden Touch - Found this on Instagram under their "secret menu" post. The workers didn't know what it was so it was kind of funny. For those of you that want to know, it was the house blended milk tea, almond pudding (I got custard pudding because they didn't have almond), ice cream, honey boba, Oreos, and caramel glaze. This was actually tasty. The Oreos were my favorite part. I would probably swap out some things to make the flavor pop a little more but I enjoyed it.   We are from San Diego so it was nice to find boba away from home.

A completely different kind of frozen treat!! I really like the shaved ice aspect (well this is what it reminded me of anyway) ---BUT BETTER.    Definitely somewhere I'd go again when wanting something different. Just wish the portions were slightly smaller. Definitely something to share if you're not a regular sweets or frozen treat kind of person.

I've been going here for awhile now and I've always been so impressed with the dessert, drinks, and customer service but I recently had the best experience I've had here. Tony, the owner, was working and I wanted to try something new since I'm kind of a creature of habit and he said with this smirk that he had just the thing. He made this magnificent looking dessert which I didn't take a picture of because I just dove right in. He came after I engulfed the whole thing and was like "I don't even have to ask, do I?" And I found that to be so profound because he was that confident in his product as he should! I wish I could give it more stars. He made my always great experience even more spectacular and truly memorable. I've definitely been back since and have witnessed firsthand how he makes each customer feel special.

Best. Stuff. EVERRRRRR! I'm sad/glad this isn't closer to me. If it was I would literally be there every single day which isn't the best thing. I tried taro with condensed milk & boba, husband got strawberry with condensed milk & strawberries (lame) I was in heaven eating mine. Soooo creamy, sweet & delicious. I will be stopping in every single time I'm in the area.

It's about time that I review Snoh...because I love it.  If you look back through my reviews to a place call Sweet Home Cafe in Hawaii, you'll see me mention a shaved ice dessert loaded with gummies and whatnot. That was a younger me losing my baobing virginity. Needless to say, once my proverbial cherry was popped, I craved more. Unfortunately for me, Arizona wasn't well acquainted with this dessert, so my craving went unsatisfied.  This was all until I saw a link to a place called Snoh on Facebook. I legitimately freaked because I was so excited! I freaked even more when I realized it was opening in my hood, right next to my apartment (you should have seen me creeping on the owners while construction was underway)!   When the day came, and they finally opened, I was in heaven. The snoh itself was delicious, and I'm sure you've read all about it in other reviews. If you're a novice to the dessert, I do not recommend getting the tea flavors of snoh...get regular, taro (which almost tastes like a mix of the buttered popcorn Jelly Belly flavor & vanilla), or one of the fruits. My favorite flavor is the taro, and my favorite combination is:  Taro Snoh Mochi Boba Aloe Vera Jelly Condensed Milk  Aside from the snoh, I frequently get the different teas with boba added, and I'll occasionally get the milk teas.   Checking Snoh out is absolutely necessary if you have a sweet tooth, or if you're looking to expand your dessert horizons. The staff has always been easygoing, and the owners are always great to have a quick conversation with, well, when the line isn't out the door.

The shaved ice is ridiculously soft and fluffy - lots of toppings to choose from, and a regular size is great to share between two people! I've come back at least once a week since we found this place!

SNOH Shavery Ice .... DOES ROCK!!!! Baby Blue Spoons, match my Naioooos ... Yah to kool.... Way to Go Tony & helpers. My taste buds.... Well they are  veeeery haaaaappeeee! You guys are great......  Yummmy on the taro,almond cookie,BoBa, Carmel glaze ..... I'lllllll B Bacccc :p
My favorite boba drinks in the entire state!  Thank you for always having consistently good boba.  The snoh is also delicious!

Definitely something to try. It is very different than normal ice cream but it is really good! I've tried milk cream and taro and they're both really good. I would say it isn't really rich and creamy but more light (but still flavorful).

My first thought when I walked into this place, it felt very much like home. There were earthy tones, art canvases for sale by local artists, soulful tunes out the speakers, and a friendly staff.   I ordered a regular sized cup with Taro, almond cookie, almonds, mochi balls, and condensed milk glaze smothered on top.   At first glance it was like no other dessert I've tried before. The layers truly looked shaved, like plowed snow from the edges of my snowboard.   As for the tasting experience, it was fluffy, as if you were to somehow turn your cotton candy into a frozen dish. It wasn't quite creamy like that of ColdStone, Thrifty, Dairy Queen, or Sonic, but I actually liked that. Meaning, I thought I ate a lot, by the look of the quantity, but I never felt full, or felt like I had a stomach ache, or had that "Dang it! I shouldn't have ate that!" feeling. Lol. No nonsense here. I have nothing but good applause for this new dessert in town. Absolutely delicious. I've tried just about every combination of Snoh, and their drinks as well.   I also have trouble saying no to the Thai tea with Boba at the bottom. That's my favorite drink! The orange colored one! It's deliciously addictive!   Almost forgot to mention, I really enjoyed the green tea with red bean, and black sesame.
This place was wonderful!  The staff was very nice and the snoh was amazing!  We ordered the matcha snow and the passion tea with boba. Both were great!  We would definitely go back.

Consistent, reasonably priced and SUPER friendly staff.  My only complaint is that I wish they offered an XXL size!  (Yeah...  I need to go on a diet...)  =/  Anywho...  This place is GREAT!  Highly recommended, especially with the hot weather coming.  GO NOW!!!

This place has pretty good prices compared to other similar places in the valley. I like their Thai Tuesdays.   Their products are good from the drinks to the snoh. I haven't tried their Brick toast, but maybe I'll talk myself into paying $8 for it one day.   My BIGGEST complaint about this place is that they run out of boba. This is the 3rd time in a row, where we have come and they don't have it. If you are craving boba, call ahead before trekking to their establishment and wasting time/gas...I could understand if Snoh was closing soon, but tonight we came at 7:15pm, which is at least an hour and 45 before closing.   Most of the time their customer service is on point. Their deserts are good. But, having their boba topping is inconsistent, which leaves me quite annoyed.

Maybe I don't get it? It literally tasted like a cup of shaved snow with a few toppings on it. We even tried two different flavors and they were both blah. I would never come back and would much rather have ice cream!

I visited Snoh for the first time today at the recommendation of a coworker. I have never had shaved ice like this before, so it was a really neat experience. The young girl working behind the counter did a good job explaining what everything was. The shaved ice really is the texture of snow. I had coconut milk shaved ice with Oreo topping and condensed milk glaze. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! I had a hard time choosing what flavor I wanted because so many of them sounded great.
My first time having boba and it was great! The facility was clean and the service was fast. I got a peach slush with boba and it was delicious.

Good snoh, good flavors, I would give four stars if the staff seemed to care at all.  Ordering for a first timer there was no help, when I asked for recommendations I just got blank stares.  But the snohs are unique to the area and tasty.  This place has a relaxed vibe, play a game or read a quirky book while seated.

What a fantastic place!  The first time I visited Snoh was last month, and I have been craving another visit since! There really aren't any words to describe this delicious treat - it's literally just like flavored snow melting in your mouth.  My favorite is the green tea flavored snoh. Sometimes,  green tea flavored things can leave a bitter aftertaste, but this was perfectly balanced. The tea flavor was noticeable yet it didn't overwhelm the other flavors. I added fresh strawberries and red bean as toppings, and drizzled condensed milk and chocolate over the entire thing. It was a great combo! I've also tried the same combination but with almond pudding instead of strawberries - also good, but I like that the strawberries added texture to the snoh.  Pros: fresh ingredients (I believe they do get fresh ingredients everyday, and they actually shave the snoh right in front of you. This snoh does not come out of a packaged machine,  thank goodness)!  The ambience is another plus. This place gives off a very hip and fun vibe. It's a great place to just lounge around with friends on a hot summer day.   Cons: I can see why this place could be a bit overwhelming for some people, especially if he/she isn't familiar to the concept of shaved and flavored ice. My advice? Just go for it! Pick flavors and toppings that are familiar to you, and just ask the guys who are making the snoh for their tips and advice.   This place is certainly worth the drive,  and I can't wait to make another visit soon.

Went back into Snoh to try and redeem the full stamp card for a large Snoh. And despite the "training" the staff was suppose to have had, I still had to battle the cashier. I was told once again it could not be redeem for anything but a small. I had to go as far as pull out my phone and my previous review with the managers comment. After holding up the line, I was granted the free Snoh. Updating my review to 4 stars, as once again, great product, just somewhat inept staff at times.

We recently visited Hawaii and fell in love with the shaved ice and wished we had something like that here in Phoenix.  Saw this place on the news and thought we'd check it out! It's awesome! They are gonna have to get a bigger place soon though! Delicious!
This place is super awesome, everything I like under one roof. Had the Taro and red bean snoh and it was good. If you haven't tried this place then "Do iiiiiiT"
Quick service, good atmosphere.  I tried the Taro milk tea, it was delicious.  Definitely  will be back.

I tried two items from their menu. The #1 which was good but I really wanted to try #7. I guess I'll come back again. I truly enjoyed their wall decor. Definitely leaves you puzzled while waiting for your order. I included a picture of their iced tea which was too sweet for my liking. I added water once I arrived home. I'll update my review later.
Tasty milk teas but very stingy on the actual tea. 75% of the drink was ice. Sorry but for $5 it's a rip off.

Been coming here since they opened in 2013 and it is our favorite dessert place! Love the menu and the owner! This place started the "snoh" movement in AZ, other places who opened after Snoh don't even compare.
Bombing place for dessert and a hangout. Recommend anyone to try it out. I got the Matcha Regular with Lychee Jelly and Mochi with Black Sesame glaze.
So weird so good. The staff is always super cool and friendly and it's the perfect dessert to Cherry Blossom next door.

Yay! Finally some shaved "snoh" in Arizona! I've been waiting for this concept to come here. Usually cravable food trends in LA eventually make their way here but damn shaved snow seemed to have taken its time to get here! What took you guys so long? I've been waiting for this for years!   Anyway, I am so glad this place has opened, as you can see lol. My favorites are taro, thai tea or green tea with mochi balls & condensed milk.  I saw on my recent visit they now have brick toast! Didn't try it because I was so full from dinner and was already trying to find room in my belly for my Snoh... but next time, for sure.  Only con is that it's quite far from me so i dont get to come indulge as often as i like. How about an East Valley expansion, guys? :)
First time. Boba slush was super icy! Was chewing chunks of ice! And watered down taro flavor. Disappointed because I love boba :(

My first time eating snow and I did get yellow snow, well it was more of a orange color.   Snoh is a new take on the whole world of frozen deserts, It is very light and full of air. And there are flavors you may not always see like Thai iced tea and taro. There are toppings like one may see at a yogurt place, but there are a few unique ones like sesame.   My real issues with the place are around price and wait time. I think the snoh is mad to order wich means the wait time and get long if they have more than say 3 customers. And the price at about $4 for a light airy ball with a topping I did not feel the value.  This place seems to be geared towards the manga animie loving crowd.

Had the original flavor both condensed milk glaze with mango pudding (by recommendation of the owners), red bean, and topped off with almonds. It was awesome!  Next time I'm going to have to try taro ice, with mochi & crushed almond cookies which looked amazing.  The place is beautifully decorated with a new aged modern Asian-American feel. I'm going to be a regular there very easily

I'm sure you've already read what Snoh is all about, so let me preface this review with my favorite flavors for you to try if you haven't already.  Taro Snoh is my ultimate favorite. For those who have never tried it before, don't let its purple hue deceive you--it is delicious! My second favorite is the honeydew. Honeydew Snoh is a very refreshing flavor to try during this summer! Do it! The AZ heat don't got nothing on these Snohs!  Might I add, that you must try the mochi balls with both the taro and the honeydew Snoh--the coconut mochi balls are my favorite topping with both Snoh flavors thus far.  Let me tell you, never in my life have I ordered a small of something and then ordered a regular/large size of it immediately after just because I could not get enough of it... I just love how its pillowy texture and delectable flavors never leave me feeling bloated and guilty.  If you're also wondering about their drinks, they're good too! I like their Thai Tea with boba.  So if you're looking for a new chill treat to try, have a go with Snoh--it's worth it. They did receive a Best of Phoenix...  "Snoh" will always be year-round in Arizona for me!  Bonus: You can enjoy your delicious dessert with visuals of the artwork that's for sale; watching what's on their TVs; and playing all sorts of fun games with the people you came with!

A really fun place to grab some delicious shaved snow. The menu has lots of great combinations and we went with the cereal milk, fruit loops, strawberries, and condensed milk. The shaved snow has fluffy and creamy. The toppings were a nice offset and provided just enough sweet and tart. There were lots of other combos that are sure to satisfy your sweet tooth. They also have an extensive bubble tea menu if you want to drink your dessert.  The space itself is in a strip mall parking lot but the interior has all sorts of interesting art and decor. It seems like a fun place to hang out and play board games.

Summary for lazy people: This place sucks.   Today I visited this "ice shavery." First off, what even is an "ice shavery?" I thought they would have snow cones, since the name of the store is Snoh. I walked in the door, excited to eat some shaved ice. I was please at their selection of television, Bobs Burgers. I have to admit it looked pretty cute on the inside, however beware..Bibere venenum in auro!!(Drink poison from a cup of gold).  It was my turn to order and I asked the lady working what exactly they were even selling... was it frozen yogurt? ice cream? WRONG. IT WAS ABSOLUTE SHIT. RIGHT FROM THE VERY OF SATANS ANUS. The lady tried to play it off saying it was "milk-ish!" and has a "REALLY good after taste!!" WRONG AGAIN. You know how rape victims explain how they feel after they have been.. abused.. well it's safe to say that after eating at Snoh, I felt rapped. empty. used. tricked. cheated. lied to.  it felt wrong even calling this food, nay, it felt worse calling it desert.   I believe this place is from China, or Japan ....  .. ..... ... ... .... . .... . .. ... .. . annnyywwaayyyy  In this part of the review I will describe the words that come to mind when I think of Snoh: garbage, nasty, rancid, inedible, foul, rank,  disagreeable, distasteful, horrible, unpleasant, unsavory, complete waste of my time.   If I could give this place a rate on a scale from one to ten, ten being the best, it would revive an infinitely low 1.   It has been 6 hours since I was personally victimized by eating at this shavery. I want to send a message to all other survivors of Snoh out there. We will get through this.. together. We will endure the hardships of the awful Snoh. I would like to propose that annually on March 2nd, (today, the day I was duped) everyone worldwide wear the color baby blue, in sympathy, appreciation, and in honor of all those who, like myself, chose to eat at Snoh and were incredibly unsatisfied.   To whom I may have offended with this review: I don't care.  These are my feelings.  'Murica.      The End.

Hooray Asian ice cream is making its way from Asia to California and New York, and finally to Arizona! This sweet concoction was one of my favorite treats during my childhood summers living on the West Coast. I ate this airy, refreshingly light ice cream as a kid and it has been years since I have had it again. How could my sweet tooth forget about this delicious treat? I suppose growing up in the Midwest where I pretty much knew it would be forever until it arrived, I suppressed my dreams of eating it again.  Thank goodness a fellow Phoenix Yelper, Andreina R. for discovering this wonderful, cheery place shaved ice meets ice cream joint (Baobing) and introducing it to me! Love the mild sweetness of the milk cream. Oftentimes, I find American ice cream on the overwhelmingly sweet side, so I was very satisfied with the perfect (in my opinion) balance of sweetness and flavor with the ice cream at Snoh Ice Shavery. Add on almond cookies, mochi, sweet red beans, and black sesame syrup and I was in ice cream heaven!   I agree with a fellow Yelper that there can be a wait if there are more than three people in line. I wanted extra toppings (i.e. mango and lychee), but I gave up after waiting for five minutes for the two people in front of me and convinced myself my teeth didn't need the extras anyways! The staff was very friendly though and I will definitely be back the next time I am in Phoenix to eat more Snoh and try the variety of milk and ice teas!
This place is awesome. The taro root boba is great! I also really like the taro root snow with condensed milk.

I've had the Thai milk tea once and it was okay. If I really am craving it, I would take it. I do come here for the fluff shaved ice though! Being a Thai tea fanatic, I get the Thai tea with condensed milk with red beans. Although my body hates me for the sugary overload, my sweet tooth is pleased! It has a fluffy texture and it is really light. The condensed milk really adds onto the sweetness, which is what I love! Parking is a nightmare though because of the restaurant next door, but my family usually eats there and then head into here for dessert and for board games. Especially for a hot Phoenix summer, this place really hits the spot.

Very clean and hip place! We have been looking for a place like this similar to back home in Hawaii.  Found it randomly when doing a search.  It's kicking up the usual shave ice bowl to another level.  Prices are reasonable just like a yogurt joint.  Kid friendly because they have toys to play with lol.  Staff are very friendly too!
Every time I come to Phoenix I always have to go here. Huge servings, inexpensive, and friendly staff.

Casual, fun place with an interesting concept and pretty good snow. Aside from their normal menu items they offer a build your own "snoh" which I love because who doesn't like customization?! In my case it was mango snow with mango pieces with sweetened condensed milk (which is basically a necessity when it comes to snow). The snow itself was good, not as fluffy as some other places but definitely passable.  When you walk in the decor immediately grabs your attention with a contemporary art vibe. They also offer a few board games which our group had a friendly connect four competition.   Overall it's a nice place if you want a change of pace for a somewhat different type of dessert
This is the best snow ice in town! Very good with lots of flavors and toppings. They have good snow and smoothies

Honest review! Went in to get some passion fruit tea with Boba. Took a sip from it. Man oh mannnnnn. That drank taste sooo water down. I'm not playing with yall! Like I have tried passion fruit tea from so many boba shop. But gosh, this was the worst. Sorry not sorry peoples! Like Idk if the employees didn't know how to make it or they were obviously lazy. Especially the guy who made it. The time I order my drank, he looked so bored working. So guessing he was lazy & probably gave me water passion fruit tea. Smh. Plus the boba wasn't even cooked all the way. If your gonna sell boba at snoh. Please know how to make boba & tea because it taste gross. Waste of my $3 something bucks. Just being honest! Dont get butt hurt, just a review. Thanks

I went here on a hot February Sunday afternoon after a leisurely walk at a parkand ordered their Lychee Fruit Tea, which definitely hit the spot. My friend got their Thai Ice Milk Tea, which was equally as refreshing. Next time, I would definitely come back to try their shaved ice desserts. They have a very neat decorative wall with cute ornaments and figurines such as Batman & Robin.

So one day I was craving Hawaiian shaved ice and there was no place i could find. So then i googled ice cream and this place came up. I walked in and at first you may look kinda stupid and clueless like i did just because the menu items were something new to me however I did try the Thai tea ice cream topped with shaved almonds and cream sauce which remind me of Mexican Lechera (probably is). I take a seat and take a spoonful and oh my my my. Doesn't feel like your regular ice cream in your mouth. I don't know how they do it but it's just so flakey, light and fluffy, you gotta try it!
Good stuff here. The Thai tea is so good. And the decorations look pretty cool and change it up from time to time

Okay, so I have now been to Snoh Ice Shavery 3 times in 4 days, the first was the night before their grand opening, then their grand opening and then 2 days later! I have brought friends and family with me since my first visit!   It is genius; really genius to open up a new, delicious yet very unique dessert eatery in HOT Phoenix!   Snoh Ice is basically a light, flavored creamy ice that has been thinly shaved to a fluffy consistency, to which one can add different toppings like fresh fruit, tapioca balls, chewy flavored mochi, flavored puddings, and a sweet glaze of your choice. The great thing about this is that the basic concept is something we are all familiar with, but at every step, we are given exotic choices, to expand our taste buds' horizons (ie. strawberry or taro Snoh ice? Mango fruit or green tea mochi? Condensed milk or black sesame glaze?) Seriously, Genius.  Having grown up in the San Gabriel Valley of SoCal (where the owners are from), I have had my fair share of shaved ice and entering this place transports me back to my childhood home!! Great job, Snoh! I will be back again in 2 days, with more friends in tow, because everyone needs to know that you guys have arrived!!

Thai ice with red beans and green tea mochi are deadly combination! It was so good that I can remember clearly the ice melts as soon as it touch your tongue. Yup it was THAT good :) Definitely will come back for some more.

It's interesting and unlike any frozen confection I ever had.  It's Fluffy Ice with the texture of Snow that's very delicate with flavor, that you Top and then add a Glaze.  The atmosphere is is fascinating like a museum with lots of pop culture to absorb.  You might get struck with confusion when trying to decide on your order as I did.   I came in thinking I'd order honeydew and then thought I'd top it with lychee fruit and then blanked out at what glaze I should glaze it with so I defaulted to ordering a coconut and topping the coconut with coconut, pineapple and butterscotch glaze. My husband just went for chocolate with chocolate glaze.  The small cup seems like a large size but it's filled with fluffy ice that has a texture just like snow but doesn't melt. Both snoh cups that I tried (coconut & chocolate) were very delicate in flavor. The coconut topping helped to add more coconut flavor and texture to the coconut. The other toppings I picked over powered the delicate coconut.  It something that I would try again but with a different flavor combination.

One of my favorite places to stop by during the hot and scorching summers of AZ. You can't go wrong with getting some snoh to help cool you down. They also have milk teas and ice teas to quench your thirst. Glad that they brought snoh into the desert so that I don't have to drive to Cali just to get some.

When it comes to dessert, it has been Cookies & Cream or bust.   I've tried so many desserts .... but nothing comparable to the Cookies & Cream .... until now.  Snoh.   The shaved ice comes in four flavors: Taro (blech), Green Tea, Thai tea, and Mango (yum!).     It's a dessert place that is small and can get loud once it gets filled up with people.   I am happy to see a large contingent of young Asian people gather in Phoenix.   I suggest find a friend and share a large here.

Great place if you are looking for something unique. Unlike other shaved ice/snowcone places, this is not just a block of ice that gets crushed/shaved with colorful syrup dumped on top. Basically the product is like ice cream (dairy in it) that is shaved instead of regular ice. Traditional Asian combinations (taro, etc.) available, but also many standards (strawberry, etc.).

Love getting my boba from here. Delicious and refreshing. My favorite is the pistachio milk tea with honey boba. However, only downside is that the parking for this establishment is always kind of annoying.
This is one of my favorite Boba place, they are really nice and fast. Also they have really fun board games, I feel welcomed there and it's a really nice environment

So its the second time I have been here, and I shouldn't have waited for this review. From the moment I took my first bite I was obsessed. Even after my boyfriend and I left we discussed how great it was. For weeks since our last visit we mentioned how we should get snoh. We are pretty much replacing the words "ice cream" and "froyo"with snoh. The thought of all desserts have been replaced with the thought of our next snob fix.   Purple Fusion is delicious! Taro snoh with almond cookie crumbs, almond pudding, and condensed milk drizzle. The girl told us to add black sesame drizzle which is also bomb.I look forward to our next trip in, and to trying more flavors. That may not before a while though since we are so satisfied with our purple fusion.   STOP READING THIS IS GO GET YOU SOME!

The vibes of this place feel like it's targeted for a younger crowd (versus older adults and families), but the shaved snow here is definitely good for everyone! Our group shared the matcha shaved snow combo (green tea snow, red bean, mochi pieces, condensed milk glaze) and a make your own of black sesame snow with grass jelly and condensed milk glaze. The shaved snow itself isn't too sweet, which makes it a good base for the delicious toppings and glazes. It's also a little dry, maybe because it's too frozen? Once it melts and is mixed with the glaze it's pretty creamy. Next time I come back I would get the matcha combo again but with grass jelly and black sesame glaze instead of the mochi and condensed milk. Not sure why but I saw some people's orders came on plates, which looked nicer than our paper bowls. Maybe you have to ask for them? Overall, this place is pretty creative and trendy with unique, non-traditional toppings like almond cookies and cinnamon toast crunch. They also have games available, which makes it a cool hangout spot for friends and family.

I'm from California , my brother lives here in Phoenix ! He is constantly bragging about his friends shop,Snoh so we decided to stop by on this beautiful evening ! And omg I'm amazed this place is freaking amazing I wish there was one back in Cali ! The staff here is so friendly , and the pictures on the walls are so dope ! I am a huge fan of Thai tea & let me tell you not everyone knows how to make it this place got it on point !!! Thanks for this amazing place tone! My son is scraping his cup for every last bit
Hands down, some of the best boba that I have ever had. Definitely top three in my book. Taro snoh is where it is at!

Love this place!!  I like their taro with boba snoh the best, and you can go wrong with any of the glazes.  Some of the snohs are really sweet so you have to be careful to pair them with less sweet toppings unless you have an intense sweet tooth.  I've only had their boba once but it was fantastic.  Recently I went with a big group of people that were not familiar with the flavors and they stayed with safe things (fruit snoh with chocolate toppings) but they also loved it.    In addition, workers are always friendly and helpful, and most will give you samples if they have time.  They play cool indie music usually, have cool art on the walls and have a nice artsy nerd vibe. They have Jenga and some other games, so it's a nice place to just chill and eat/drink something delicious.
It's thee Bomb.com/.org/.net!! xD

It was my first visit at Snoh.  Thought I'd try it out since it was next door to the lunch spot I tried.  I have had this type of desert elsewhere and I thought Snoh was just O-K.  I think it fell short with the decor and it wasn't welcoming. It appears to cater to a certain age group and or what we've heard of "hipsters".  Music is old school to today's hip hop and R&B. I also agree that their deserts are pricey that another Yelper reviewed.  I tried their "purple fusion" - taro shave snoh, almond cookies, almond jelly and instead of condensed milk I had caramel. Both the taro and the almond jelly (asian jello) was very faint in taste. I thought it was underwhelming.  I may try this place out again, but will try something very different.  I have liked taro deserts in the past, so it's not that I am not familiar with it or the Asian jello because I am familiar with it.    It seems that this is newer business, but the decor seems outdated and areas that aren't clean: tables and the couch has multiple stains. A complete turn off. Customer service is blah.

What a hidden gem! This place was fantastic and will be seeing me again. First, I walk in with my date who has been here before, and I see a very clean and trendy place. I'm a superhero lover by nature, and there's fun comic pictures all along the walls. I'm not sure if they're made locally but they're really cool! They also have four really awesome ninja turtle drawings on the wall towards the restrooms. So cool!   Anyway, I locate the flavors on the menu, and they have quite a few. I choose honeydew flavor snoh, and ask the worker at the register what goes best with it. He recommends processed milk syrup and almond cookies. So I order it, prices are pretty reasonable, and the cashier was friendly... It doesn't take long  to come out even though there was a little line. And the dish.... Was delicious! My date got a taro one with black sesame and almond cookies and he let me try. That was so delicious too!   I highly recommend trying this little place out. As I said, it'll be seeing me again!

Love this stuff. It's the first time I've come across this popular and traditional dessert in Phoenix.   The place is clean and decorated with various trendy art pieces and photos. The staff has been nice each time I've been here.   I had an original ice with mango and black sesame glaze. I liked that it's not very sweet and that it's light/fluffy and not dense. I've also tried the Thai tea ice with almond pudding and a condensed milk glaze. Thai tea definitely hit the spot.

The shaved ice is like the Taiwanese shaved ice I've had in Taiwan where the ice is shaved so fine, it's almost like ice scream. We had the large taro & black sesame flavor with condensed milk, mochi and almond pudding. Almond pudding and mochi were pretty good, but not super awesome. And you can never go wrong with condensed milk! Overall I thought it was pricey but pretty good.  They've also got fun games you can play with friends while hanging out :)

Normally I love this place, but tonight was a different story. We came in ten minutes before closing and noticed the TV menus were off. I asked the cashier if they were still open because I didn't want to order and be rude knowing it was close to closing. She rolled her eyes and replied, "Um, I guess." She turns the menus back on since she knew she was trying to close early. I asked what kind of milk they used and the chubby girl making snow acted like we were doing her a disservice by asking about ingredients and replied, "Um it's non-dairy milk." She acted very condescending after we were nothing but polite. When we walked out I was about to say "good night" but the chubby girl rolled her eyes at me because I ordered close to closing. All I ordered were two boba teas. I highly doubt my friends and I will be coming back solely on the principle of their terrible customer service and rude attitude. I understand it was ten minutes before closing, but our orders weren't complicated.

Shaved Ice, It's not a snow cone, not even close.   Hard to explain exactly what it is so you must just go try it.  I stepped out of my comfort zone and glad I did.  Everything was nice and clean the way it should be and super nice employees.   $4 for a small Snoh Ice was plenty big enough for two of us.  Also tried a Pomegranate-Passion fruit Iced tea that was as refreshing as it sounds.

I liked how they put their shaved us in a bowl and then put it onto a plate. The food presentation is really good. The shaved ice was yummy but their red bean was hard and not mushy. It tasted like it was still frozen or not cooked at all. I didn't get a chance to try their brick toast dessert, which I really wanted to. Next time!

I got their thai tea shave ice with oreo crumbs & mochi bites but it wasn't impressive. However, i was impressed that they carried plastic spoons that were made of reused material, eco friendly, that's what's up! I still prefer Vampire Penguin in Sacramento though.  I did enjoy the unique "hipsteresque" atmosphere. Plenty of awesome works of art from comic characters to twistedly dark Adventure Time & FunkoPops with Halloween decorations mixed in. They also carried board games. Can't go wrong with the classics of Uno & Connect 4.

apparently this is a california staple, and it just opened here in the valley. via a friend, we popped in after dinner last night. our friend was having a difficult time explaining the texture of this new fangled ice treat, we just had to experience it ourselves.   basically, it's like airy ice crystals....like cold cotton candy texture. it's light and fluffy and airy and really good! from what i understand, its flavored ice that is shaved....not shaved ice with flavor added. anyway, it's not crunchy like ice crystals or shaved ice....it's smooth but not like ice cream or custard or yogurt. really, you just have to try it.  at the counter, you order one of about a dozen base flavors. i opted for taro, but there are many tradtional flavors. then you opt for one topping for a small, 2 for a medium, 3 for a large, or pay extra for extra toppings. then you get a glaze. the most popular at the moment seemed to be sesame seed, but i chose condensed milk and kiwi as my topping.   it was a surprise. i thought the taro would be more tart, but it really wasn't. then with the creamy sweetness of the condensed milk, it was a delicious sweet melt-a-thon on a hot summers evening. my only complaint was that they were a little stingy on the glaze, so if you eat the top portion of your treat, there is no glaze left to enjoy for the remainder of the dessert. our friend went back to the counter and asked for more glaze which they obliged.   a new way to cool off in the valley and a nice change from all the yogurt shops.

First time I've tried snoh ice and it didn't disappoint me. It was so good! Definitely will come back again. Serving size was reasonable and customer service was very good. The place looks cool and clean. I will try their boba drinks next time I visit.
My favorite place to stop! The boba is easily the best tasting I've ever had, and I have trouble deciding since it all looks so good! Everyone is always pleasant when I'm there and are happy to help.

This place hits the spot on a hot day. We had the coconut and Thai shaved ice with various toppings. I became addicted to this in Taiwan and later living in NYC. This place has great flavors and really fresh toppings. Yum!

I love this place. I love it so much we drive out here from Avondale. I was excited when they opened. Finally a place that serves Asian desserts specially boba.  It's a nice place to meet with friends. They have board games, tv to watch either Netflix or a sporting event.  The place is decorated with a clean artsy design. The have paintings by local artists displayed.  The only  is the bathroom. They only have one and when it's busy or someone decides to do more than #1 it's very obvious. My suggestion they should invest in some poo-pourri.   I usually order the Thai tea with boba.  I've also had their almond milk tea with boba and lychee jelly. As for the snoh we usually order a large and share it.  That way we get to pick 2 flavors of snoh and 2 toppings.  I like green tea, taro, Thai tea and black sesame snoh.  My favorite toppings are boba, lychee jelly, mango pudding, and almond pudding (it's more like jello but with and Asian twist).  As for the glaze I like black sesame and Nutella.  If you aren't familiar with snoh its flavored ice that is shaved so fine it's like eating snow.

If you want snoh, iced tea or milk tea ...Snoh is such a fun place to go to.  This place has a great atmosphere and vibe. They have nice art works displayed on the wall and board games to play.   Many choices and add on for the snoh to choose from.  I had taro and strawberry snoh. Both were all great.  The small size portion were more than enough for the kiddos & I.  I also had pistachio milk tea for the first time and it was amazing.  They also have a rewards program to earn points.  I would recommend this place if you want to give it a try! :)

When I used to drive by this place I was always so skeptical about a entire business just selling shaved ice. Sounded so silly to me, already making judgement on what could possibly be in this place.  I eventually walked by it after dinner next door, and oh wow. So glad I did, the place is very casual and very relaxing hang out environment could definitely see the place being a neat spot to meet up with friends and talk.   The shaved ice was totally unexpected. It was so so so good, never had a desert treat like that before ever. Definitely plan to go back and try some of their other options.  The shaved ice had the consistency of snow but how this place presents the treat is really cool. You customize how you want it first your flavor, toppings and then a glaze, which is unlike any shaved ice I've ever had, nom nom nom.

This is the best place to get boba in the valley. Hands Down! Boba is always fresh and available. I highly recommend the Lavender Milk Tea but other flavors are good, too. Try Honey Green, Pistachio and the house tea. The service is excellent, kids are welcome, and it's fun to play the games they provide.

This place is excellent! Every Saturday after Cherryblossom, we go to Snoh and have delicious milk tea or what they refer to as "snoh" which is basically the consistency of snow. Very light, and powdery.  Positives: -Fun atmosphere  -Great products--definitely try everything once  Negatives: -Little too expensive. You get a lot, but not a lot of snoh. -Staff is a little abrasive  Overall, I will definitely be back.
Awesome and friendly service.  Perfect for a hot days. Passion tea with Boba and coconut snoh amazing

They have great flavors and I like the variety of toppings they offer. The Snoh is soft and melts in your mouth. The only thing I wish they would do with the condensed milk is layer in between the snoh. The top part is flavorful and good but midway through, it looses the flavor and doesn't taste as good.
I love the different flavors they have!  I've tried the honeydew mango n pistachio n coconut n I recommend all of them lol..

Anyone who doesn't like Asian shaved ice has no soul.  Literally, they must have no sense of adventure, whimsy and lightness.  After a huge heavy meal (usually Thai or Indian) I crave something sweet but I'm so full!  What to do? Snoh to the rescue. It is sweeter than ice cream, but manages the impossible!  It is light, melt in your mouth in seconds snoh.  Forget granitas, ices or snoh cones.  The texture of this is what I imagine unicorn tears to be.  You can customize with flavor of snoh, you pick your topping(s) and a glaze (extra sugar delivery mechanism).  If I were better at math I could tell you how many combinations you can make.  They have a van for parties, so you can bring it to the office should you like.  They have punch cards (which I've run turn embarrassingly quickly).  It is bright and fun, they have interesting art on the wall that changes.  They have board games to play should you decide to not focus on the snoh itself.  Oh and it has huge stacks of dessert toast.  Just order it and be happy.
My friend brought me here and I've already brought two friends back! I love Snoh, very unique and super tasty! The staff is super friendly as well.

I tried this place out last week with my sister since we were in the area. The the place was cute and they made our order pretty quickly. They had so much on the menu that I had a hard time figuring out what to order. I finally ordered a chai tea and it tasted ok. I know they had other fruit drinks since my friends had brought me some there before , but because the menu had so much on there I had a hard time searching for it so I went ahead and order the first thing I saw that I might like.

I LOVE stopping here when I come to visit my family!  Customer Service is awesome!  Love the flavors they offer!  I love the Taro, with the condensed milk, and black sesame. If ever you are in the area stop by this place.

(Lyrics - Rihanna ft. Mikky Ekko - Stay)  All along it was just shavings A cold ice freezing believer I threw my hands in the air I said show me something He said, if you dare then add a little chocolate  Round and around and around and around I went Ohhh now tell ya now tell ya now tell ya now I know (what to order)  Not really sure how to feel about it Something in the way it taste Makes me feel like I can't live without it It takes me to a cooler place I want some more Snoh.......!  I was "snow" ice shavings were first brought to my attention when I traveled to LA.  Wasn't sure what the rave was about, but I gave it a try.  At the time I thought it was a pretty cool concept and didn't know why Phoenix didn't have it --- Cause we live in the damn desert!    Finally, "Snoh" ice was brought to us by this place -- Thank you Snoh Ice Shavery.  You didn't even come up with some weird name, just tell us what it is; ice shavings with consistency like snow haha!    The place itself has a LA tea boba shop feel.  A lot Asian kids hanging around and reading some Manga.  Man I'm getting too old for this place!    Overall, "snoh" shavings here are pretty good.  Your choice of toppings from gummy bears, tapioca, lychees, strawberries, and chocolate syrup.  Similar to your self-pour yogurt shops, but "snoh" is ice shavings so you amount of calories are much much much more lower than your average desert.  That's why I totally appreciate this awesome invention.  Not to say you should eat this for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner.  Everything in moderation is fine.  Our host was very gracious and also the marketer for this place.  Well done my friend, but I still think Ironman would crush Batman! Wink! - Enjoy!

Amazing boba. If you want quality boba come here, however the owner is incredibly impersonal.  Going to a snoh is uncomfortable and not a pleasant experience. Snoh, we love you, we just hope you change your customer service, remember your regulars, and keep serving that great boba.
Been here a ton and truly can't choose a favorite. Coconut, strawberry, Thai, and taro snoh and Thai tea are all great!

Food: Black sesame shaved ice with red beans, almond pudding, and condensed milk. I picked the black sesame and I took the cashier's suggestion for the toppings. I liked the subtle taste of the black sesame. The almond pudding and condensed milk complemented the shaved ice. I should have passed on the red beans, I took one bite and then ate around it. lol. 3/5  Service: This place was packed on a Friday night at 8:30pm. All the tables were taken so we ended up sitting on the chairs in front of the store. The cashier was friendly. We got our snow ice pretty quickly. $4.50 for a small. 3/5  Final thoughts: I'll definitely come back to try other flavors. No red beans for me next time :)

I went in with high hopes, but I have to be honest here. The owner is a nice guy. I've met him a few times before stopping in. The young man working was also very pleasant. I ordered my personal favorite, the Taro smoothie, and after a number of sips, wondered if it was just water and ice I was drinking. Sure, it was the light purple color I'm familiar with, but there was no flavor. So I politely asked to swap it out for something the worker would personally recommend, which ended up being some sort of Thai iced coffee. That too ended up being a little bland in taste, but I really didn't want to be "that guy", so I sucked it up, literally, and let it be.   Snoh has some very positive reviews and I didn't want to bring them down, knowing how kind the staff are, but that was my experience. On the plus side, the pop culture decor inside is fantastic. I absolutely love that. I should mention that the service was quick as well. With all the places out there that offer the same drinks, I'm not sure I'd return though after two disappointing drinks in one visit.

We were in Hawaii last year, so when we saw this place were on it. If I didn't know any better, I'd swear it was ice cream. What to say but YUMMY!!! I had a coconut pineapple Carmel delight. My sweet had coconut with lychee. We so loved the texture and the flavors. Try it yourself, as I can't dream up more words to rag on!!!

I live in Dallas but i travel to Arizona about twice a year. Each time I make it out there I make it a point to stop at Snoh Ice because there is nothing like it. It is something so different and fun. The location is great, the place is clean, and the options are endless. I wish they would open something similar to this in Dallas! They did mention something about opening a location similar to Snoh in Houston but Dallas needs one too. I can't wait for my next trip to Phoenix to visit again! In my 3 day trip I managed to make it there twice, it's addicting!

Really love this place compared to Snowmonster in California.. But this is the only snow place in AZ I know so.... -shrugs- This place could be better with some other snack foods like wings or nachos or something. I have salt cravings too y'know!

You can play games here. It's a fun place to hang out while you eat dessert after eating at Cherry Blossom Cafe next door.  It definitely has some good flavors! Try it! I didn't see a lion dancer in the store. They should have one on request. That would be awesome.

The snow combinations here are very interesting. I like the more classic stuff like a taro snow with mochi, fruit, and boba. And more mochi... you can never have too much mochi. I also learned that the snow and teas here don't use milk? Can someone confirm for me if this is true? The snow has never bothered me, but I thought that was just a good day as a lactose sensitive/intolerant person. I've avoided milk teas for a few years now, but golly, if it's true that they don't use dairy milk in their tea drinks, I might be in heaven. I guess next time I come here, I'll try a milk tea or thai tea and see what happens.  This would have have been a five-star review except for the fact that a funny thing happened the first time I was here. I ordered their mango snow combo, which I think is number 6. Whoever was taking orders that night got confused between combo 5 and combo 6 (I might be confusing the numbers here because I'm going off memory from over a month ago), so they wrote the wrong number on the cup. I wound up with the Mountain Dew/Honey Dew combo instead. Since it happened to my friend who ordered the same thing as me, we realised what had happened.
