I thought it was a funny incident, so we didn't make a big deal of it at the time, but it is going to ding a little bit here.   Nonetheless, I really like this place for boba and snow. The pop art/nerd cultural art is really great and fun to browse too. I think if I can confirm that the items here are dairy free, I'll update it for a five-star review, so stay tuned!

I have been craving red bean ice with condensed milk for years... years I tell you! I am so grateful this place opened and wish them all the success in the world.   If you haven't been here, do yourself a favor and stop in. (not so much a favor for your thighs, but who's counting calories when something this delicious exists in AZ!?) You won't regret it!  The staff is great too! :D

Short review: Good, but if you've had the shaved ice in SGV (San Gabriel Valley in California) then it doesn't compare. Very good though overall.  Long review: Ever since I've had baobing in SGV 6 years ago, it's stayed in my memory as one of the best desserts that AZ is missing. It's so hot here 9 months a year, why wouldn't they open one? I'm so glad it finally has its place now in Phoenix. The flavor options are limited, but they are adding more.  My favorite so far is any of the shaved ice with all of the almond options. I recommend getting the syrups/milks on the side and add on slowly as to not oversweeten the dessert. I hope they eventually expand the menu even further and add a wide variety of flavors and have even better ripe and fresh fruit toppings. My go to place for dessert anytime I'm in Phoenix. (edited for grammar) :)

I love this place, its like a little gem in Phoenix! I love getting a medium size with taro snoh, red bean, mochi balls and then sesame seed sauce or condensed milk! Amazing combo! The first time i ever went there and had no idea what i was doing, the two Hispanic girls behind the cashier helped me a tremendous amount and was super nice, not making me feel like i was a complete idiot. Lol.. Another great thing is they have stamp cards! So if you're an addict like myself, you'll get a free one atleast once a month! Ps try their Brick Toast! Yummy!

I usually find places like these in bigger cities like San Francisco or New York but to find this type of game room/dessert bar combo in the middle of the desert makes it extra special especially on a hot day. Stopped in here to introduce shaved ice to my bestie. I ordered the taro shaved ice with condensed milk, Mochi and fruity pebbles. The small was perfect for sharing but order the larger size if you want more toppings otherwise the small does well for two toppings. I honestly don't think there's a difference in shaved ice but if you've never had it before, this is a great solid place to start (it should have the texture of fallen untouched snow). What sets this place apart is the decor (very comic book and anime loving which I love) and the games they offer while chilling (uno, jenga, cards, connect four)

Great place for great dessert and drinks.  Prices are way reasonable.  The snoh flavored ice shavings are actually light tasting and not overly sweet so it works well with the selection of syrup and toppings.  The toast tastes great too!

So compared to the other times I've come here with my boyfriend (three) this one was by far the best. The guy at the counter was really friendly and was just much more welcoming then the regular staff here (So much more that I gave him a better tip then I normally would have.) Snoh has a good variety of flavors so we try to try something new each time, so far we've tried the Thai tea, mango, pumpkin spice and pistachio snoh with pistachio being my absolute favorite! (it's the sweetest of the flavors we've had) I recommend giving this place a try it is literally unlike anything I've ever had and it's definitely worth it!
This incredible place makes living in Phoenix all the worth while.  No more flying to Los Angeles for shaved ice. I think it just got BEST OF PHOENIX They deserve it.  I'm in heaven now !

This place hits the spot. My favorite flavor of snoh is either the coconut milk, black sesame, or thai tea. There are so many flavors and toppings to chose from that nearly everyone will find something they like. Also, the boba is pretty descent here. The house milk tea with boba is definitely worth a try.

I live in California, so it was really nice to see shaved snow/milk tea near downtown Phoenix, where I was staying. I only tried their house blend milk tea, which was sweet for my taste, but it had really good flavor. There are a lot of tables, and a restroom as well, so it's a good place to come with a group and hang out!
I love the strawberry green tea with black pearls! It's hard to find a drink that isn't too sweet! Coming from the fat straws in Texas, this place will do just fine!   I highly recommend this place!
Ohhhhh man.....great place to get shaved ice....I had me a Mango Tango and it was the BOMB!!! Gonna try the other items cuz they looked yummy!!!....cant wait to go back.

Gotcha matcha! Amazing! This place is so cool! Love the atmosphere. So excited to eat this! Okay, if you really like my matcha get it if you're unsure do not I was not a fan but I will say the breakfast bowl, delicious... mango, yum.
Love it here! Great vibes awesome service!  my cousin loves the peach tea and I love the passion fruit tea w/boba.  I recommend trying out this cool place! You won't regret it!
Amazing and amazing.   Everything is good here so you won't be disappointed with whatever you decide to get.  It's a must to try the brick toast if you haven't

Forget waxing, shaved is the way to go. (not like anyone would really wax ice, but whatevs...)  For me:  shaved thai tea, cinnamon toast crunch, mochi, and condensed milk glaze.  For him: shaved original, mochi, and black sesame glaze. Just like the one in the picture. :) For us: A unanimous rating of OMG that's delicious and light and fluffy and did I mention delicious? But the cinnamon toast crunch was the best!  This was our first time here, but won't be our last. The guy at the counter seemed kinda bored, but was very helpful when he saw that we didn't really know how to order.   While waiting for our order we learned a little about the Tibetan jumping spider and the Himalayan Chiru antelope (did you know they have twice as many red blood cells as humans? Fascinating!)...Education and Sustenance, awesome!

Was not at all what I expected, but in a good way for sure. Super light and almost fluffy, if you can say that about shaved ice. Got the taro with almond cookie and black sesame glaze. Very good and a cool vibe in this tiny little joint that was packed on a Saturday evening.

We do not have a place like this anywhere in Phoenix, and let me tell you, the place is outstanding.The employees were very nice, answered all of my questions and make good suggestions. Similarly to cold stone, you order the size cup you want, then pick a flavor of shaved ice with a free topping and free sauce. I ordered the taro shaved ice with sweet black sesame sauce and almond pudding topping. The guy suggested I get something crunchy as a topping too to balance it out, but I was too overwhelmed with new & exciting flavors I had never heard of or tasted. The shaved ice is soft and fluffy. I think I was expecting it to be more like ice chips- tough & crunchy. The texture reminded me almost of cotton candy- soft and fluffy, but condenses as soon as the wetness of your mouth hits it. It was sweet, but not overly sweet and the flavors had richness to them. Everything was fresh and completely delicious. The interior is modern and clean. Hooray for something new and delicious. I work less than 1/2 mile from here and know I will spend way too much money in this place.

Love the atmosphere. Love the fact that they are set up, wanting you to spend some time there and hang out. They have board games and things you can play while you're chilling. The shaved ice is delicious and they have some great combinations. We need a location in the North Valley. :)
We love this place!! Every time we come we get great service and yummy drinks!! They keep the lines moving fast and it's a great place to get some boba in Phoenix

Found this place by accident but very good selection for shave ice. I've been looking for shave ice place when I travel and this place is good as some places in LA and Bellevue.  I wish they make this place a chain. Would go back again if I'm back in PHX.
Love the shaved ice!! Is was the best I ever had! I wish that we have this in LA where I live! This was an icestastic place!!!
Love this place! Best boba in town! Love that I can order from Ubereats with them as well. Boba any time!

So I'm not an ice cream person, nor do I really enjoy shaved ice, so of course I'm a bit biased. The milk cream was the only flavor I really could imagine what it would taste like (the equivalent of vanilla) and added to it, some Nutella, coconut and almonds. I barely tasted the Nutella...but I guess it was ok for what it was. The texture was a bit bothersome for me, kind of hard to eat...I think if you're into ice cream and boba...This will be right up your alley. If not, good luck deciphering the menu!

When you get here it is... Decisions, decisions, decisions....  What size to get, what flavor to get, what toppings to get, and then what sauce to get....  They ALL sound so good....    After standing in line for 5 mins and staring at the menu (with my glasses on), OH CRAP it is my turn...  Small, Thai tea, mochi balls with condensed milk sauce came out of my mouth.    I waited less than 5 mins and they called me name for picking up.  It looks so yummy!!!  It was really good!  It was icier than I expected.  I thought it would be creamy.  But it is called Snoh!  It is a fun, happening place.  L, G, and I plus a few friends ran into Nader there!!  Nice to see where all the Yelpers flock to new places!

Stopped by this place for bubble tea and ended up just buying regular thai tea. Reason is because I couldn't stand the idea of paying $7 just for bubble tea. Atmosphere was great. Tea was good. But prices are crazy. But I'm from the South, so maybe that's why I can't cough up that much money for just a drink.

It's pretty good, but don't come here expecting like a snow cone shaved ice. The shaved ice here is almost like ice cream but it's still a little icey. It was a surprise to me at first but it's like snow almost. Hence the name snoh. Pretty awesome.

Yes!!!! I have a twin here in Phoenix by the name of Brenda or is it Susan?! Reason is cause I come here many times and sometimes more than once in a day!  Hence my alias cause I don't want the guys in there working to know that I'm addicted to their confections!  Yummmmm, I just love everything they have to offer here.  When I would go back to Taiwan, the first place I always go to is a shaved ice place to satisfy my shave ice fantasies!!  Now I don't have to fly to Taiwan for the same delectables- hey, what I would have spent on a plane tkt, I can spend on shaved ice at this place! I tend to shy away from the Americanized flavors like strawberry and go for flavors like taro, Thai ice tea, green tea, mango, and original milk flavor. Oh wait, I think I just listed ALL the ice flavors as my favorite. Haha. I'm not surprised.  I also love all the toppings mochi ball, mango, yum yum I say.  Please the drizzles- love both the black seasame and condensed milk! Oh, and don't go for the small- go for the LARGE like I do and ask for it on a plate- they'll give you two flavors and two types drizzles and two types of toppings. Get the picture?  HEAVEN on a plate!!!!! I love the vibe of the place, hype and modern.  And the guys who work there too- they play along with me when I give them my aliases- I have to love them for that!

Super unique funky place to grab tasty cold treats.   The texture of snoh really is like a light weight snow, though I haven't felt snow in ages, unfortunately.    Location:  In the same shopping center as a Cherry Blossom, a tasty restaurant.  The parking lot can get crowded midday for lunch time.    Food/drinks: Snoh offers the snoh treats and iced teas with the bubbles.  The snoh treats are interesting and unique with the base snoh treat, then toppings, plus the icing. For example, I got the coconut snoh, my topping included Oreos, and the icing was caramel. I know, a bit of an odd selection.   Service: The employees were friendly for the most part. However, one person had a complaint, and the employee was arguing about the situation.  But, it was taken care of with free food.    Ambiance: Funky - games, interesting artwork and TVs on.

This place is awesome, if you want to go somewhere with unique and delicious desert go here! I love the shaved ice and the milk teas are my favorite! I love the Tarro Milk tea with Leachi! They have all kinds of boards games to enjoy and have great geeks are work!

When trying to figure out what I would write for this review, and how many stars to award it, I was at a loss for words.  Snoh is so unlike anything I have ever eaten before, that I wasn't sure if that was a good thing or a bad thing.  I am not a stranger to taro, green tea, mochi or anything, but I think I have concluded that they are just not flavors that appeal to me.  We brought my niece and nephew to Snoh because they are huge fans of frozen concoctions.  Never having been to Snoh before, we were a little lost looking at the menu.  I asked the employee what kids normally get there and he said original with Oreo and extra chocolate glaze.  I got the mango ice with mangoes and caramel glaze.  I didn't really want a glaze, but he acted like it was an essential part of the dessert.  I have to say that it would have tasted much better without the caramel glaze.  My sister in law got condensed milk on the top of hers and she couldn't even finish it.  If you want to get out of your comfort zone, this is a great place to do it.   I, however, will stick to good old fashioned ice cream.

Cool little spot to grab a treat and hang out. Everything I've had here is so delicious, the people are always super friendly and if you don't know what you want just ask! I ask for suggestions almost every time and it's always good.
Been coming here for several years, and it never fails to disappoint. Tons of selections, and pretty much everything tastes unique. Highly recommend trying.
Almost daily habit for me!  Super yummy, great prices and their boba is best ive had!!

Love it! The only place that I have found in AZ that serves shaved snow! Was totally missing LA and the many shaved snow places there. Me and my friends were REALLY excited to find that it lived up to our standards. We went last weekend and it was about the 4th time we've been there AND they had brick toast NEW on their menu. It was pretty good, except I thought the almond cookie was a little weird on it, but overall it was a great taste of home. I got the taro shaved snow with condensed milk and black sesame sauce. AMAZING if you like taro and black sesame.

Friend of mine recommended this place while I was out in the Phoenix area. Not what I expected. Who knew you could find a snow ice place like what you could find in LA all the way in Phoenix? Lots of great flavors and toppings, like strawberry and black sesame, as well as your sauce toppings, like condensed milk, chocolate, strawberry and more black sesame.   Lots of cool pop art and comic book related art on the walls. The patrons were not all Asian.  It's not even in an Asian part of town.  This place is killing it and that's not a surprise.  Not too hard to sell snow in the desert.

Friday night, homework all completed, quarter tank left, where does this young college student go too?! SNOH!!! Yup, no parties but this ever-so delightful gem in Phoenix. The shaved ice is phenomenal, not to sweet, but enough to hit the right palette. Customer can get a choice of ice, toppings, and sweetener- I chose the condensed milk. Yummm... Anyways, great place to socialize with friends while at the same time trying there delectable treats. Great find!  PS: I drove 20 miles from Mesa on a Friday night to get here. That should say it at all!!
Sweet little local dessert place, everything is delish and staff is very knowledgeable
Updating from two weeks ago. Toddler didn't like the texture, more for me. Wish it was closer, then I'd be a regular.
First time trying this place out. My shaved ice looked nothing like the pictures on yelp and they were out of everything. Very disappointed
The best thai tea and taro!  Very pleasant environment,  love the decor, and great service.

Although a bit overpriced, this place is quite good. I have been here several times now and have tried the green tea and thai tea flavors; the ice is very fluffy and light like snow. My favorite is green tea ice with red bean, almond pudding, and condensed milk. I try to stop by when I go to Cherry Blossom. I wish this place was closer to me!
I tried the thai tea with boba, red bean, and condensed milk glaze.  Yummy!  I will go back again - probably on a weekly basis.

AMAZING! Every time I am in the Greater Phoenix area I always make a stop in to Snoh. Sure there is a line, but trust me it is worth the wait! If you like ice cream and shaved ice, this place is the place to go because it is smack dab in between the two kinds of desserts. My personal favourite is their Taro with mochi, boba, and condensed milk, but I have yet to have something there that isn't just flat out delicious. Give this place a shot for dessert when you're nearby!

stopped in cause i love Shave Ice but it's hard to find good stuff here.  the place is a decent size and very clean inside.  I ordered the Original with mangos and Milk Glaze.  i bought the Small cause it seemed really big (and it was really big) but it was so amazing that i wished i got the large.  the guy working the counter was friends and helpful and i can't wait to go back and try some other flavors!  People just need to be aware, this is NOT a snow cone place, if you are looking to get one of those you need to keep looking!

I'm from out-of-town but I tried this place a few years ago and absolutely fell in love with it even though I am not a dessert person. The Snoh was so light, full of flavor, and just melted in your mouth. I could not wait to return to Phoenix to try the infamous Snoh again.  A few years later I finally make my return and maybe I had been hyping it up too much in my mind for the last few years. Did they change owners? Not sure. The Snoh did not taste as great as it used to. My friend and I ordered the milk cream and taro Snoh and it just didn't have the same great texture and flavor as it did a few years ago. My milk cream Snoh just tasted like  ice. Luckily, we added a condensed milk glaze to amp up the flavor. The honey boba is great. I was disappointed they were out of mango and almond pudding...we settled for custard pudding and mango pudding which were both pretty standard...
My favorite here are Gotcha Matcha and Thai tea. Took my mom here and she loved the Gotcha Matcha.

Stumbled into this place waiting for some dominos pizza (not good but still good). Loved the interior of the place. Felt like I time traveled to China.   The concept is interesting and perfect for the high temperatures in Phoenix.   A great healthy alternative.  Many Many flavors to choose from. It being my first time there, I had no idea what I was doing so I just threw some ingredients together. Wouldn't mind visiting again.

I have loved SNOH for quite a while. I tell people about SNOH all the time. As yummy as SNOH is, their employees and customer service priceless. Smiling, helpful, engaged and present. Yesterday, my friends son knocked his SNOH over during a competitive game of Jenga. Being only seven years old, he of course was distraught. The staff at SNOH were quick to console him, come help clean and offer to replace his SNOH.  #hellohumankindness

Amazing service, amazing staff! I recommend this place to everyone who love desserts that aren't overwhelmingly sweet.   Snoh has that mix of traditional Asian sweets with an American twist which is awesome! I love the different spin they take on sweets I grew up with as a child.  Just as awesome as any iced shavery in California.

I don't even know where to start. I thought I was an expert on shaved ice places, but man, was I ever wrong. Bahama Bucks has always been my favorite place, but this takes it to a new level.  First off, the ambience. You walk in and everything is crisp and clean. Definitely a modern feel, with a bit of comic book/gamer twist. You have art for sale on the walls next to posters of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.   You choice from 3 different sizes, 9 different flavors, 18 different toppings, and 5 different glazes on top. If you have any questions, make sure to ask the staff as they were quite helpful! I know other reviewers have commented on the service being shotty, but maybe they hired new people as everyone there was super nice and accommodating.   I didn't really know what to expect when I got my order. I made sure to get a little piece of everything in my first spoonful. Let me tell you, you have never tasted anything like it. The consistency was super smooth, and the flavors just jump out of the bowl. It was the best dessert I have ever had in my life. ever. bar none.  I did get a chance to try their Thai Iced Tea with Boba. It was really good. Nothing super special, but a good complement to the entry. They have a good choice of milk teas and smoothies as well.  Do not forget to bring your loyalty stamp card as you will be back!  I had gone to Cherry Blossom a few dozen times, and was always to full to try Snoh. Now, I will be sure to always save some room!

The staff is so dope here.  Especially the chick with the nose ring she brought out the vibes to this place. Keep her and promote her. She was just dope. The guy who made my snoh had the vibe too and made my snoh look good. My friends loved the snoh so this is why I'll give it 4 Stars. The snoh was not for me. I forced myself to like this snow like ice-cream but ehhhhh not for me.. the flavors was subtle but the toppings? Yummmm fruity pebbles and m&m's and caramel yes please!

When ever we come to Arizona  we visit Snoh. it's one of our favorite place for desert . We always have a good experience , but this time my wife had bought a groupon deal. The person behind The counter was not so happy about us using the groupon. This was the first time that we had used Groupon so we had some question about how to use it. He was not to happy and didn't want to help us,so We went and sat down and fingered it out And come back to the counter and ordered Our desert. Our coupon was for $10 and our Snoh came to $7 . I asked him if we would get $3 credit and he gave me the dirtiest look and said no. So I ordered one more item and I owed $1.90 more. After I paid him he asked me if I had anymore questions . Wow ready,,, we got our Snoh and it was good but we never got our Vietnamese coffee. My wife told him that we never got the coffee  and his reply was I thought I gave it to you and I'll make another one... We never got the first one so no I will me you another one is wrong. The right answer would be I forgot to make it for you I'm sorry  and let me make one for you now. We will give them another try and hope that this was just a bad day for him and every customer is important Groupon or not.-
Ive been here twice and both times they have run out of cups! It is very maddening. Please have more cups. I do have to say the shaved ice is really good but Im really just interested in the Boba.

I'm clearly late to the Snoh party but I concur with all the good things said, and my worst at Snoh has never been truly "bad" in terms of service, even if not quite as on the ball as at their best.  I generally find the staff pleasant, helpful, and patient as I and others dawdle for what must seem an eternity to staff (and those behind us in line) in making our decisions from all the possible combinations.  I love the taste of this stuff.  Everything combination I've had in 3 or 4 visits, whether a green tea, thai tea, strawberry, or mango base.    I spent a year in the northeast of mainland China over a quarter century ago (just call me "lao") and all snow we got quickly received a generous coating of coal dust, making it roughly as appetizing as yellow snow, so even after a year in the motherland,  I can tell you that for me it's a new and unique treat and beats red bean popsicles all to pieces!  There is nothing comparable to this incredible lightness of being combined with all the of lush refreshing flavors and comforting coldness in the Arizona heat (Well, unless you stop in for "snow" at Pho Avina way up North 49th Ave & West Thunderbird way).    While I'd agree at least a bit with reviewers who thought each size somewhat over-priced for what you get, as much as I'd like to wallow in a field of snoh, make snoh angels  - and EAT THEM (preferably for free), I think the prices not terribly out of line for what is at this time a new, unique desert dessert adventure in a unique and comfortable, even sophisticated, setting.  It's kind of like the fabled "Starbucks experience", but younger, in lighter color Copenhagen wood tones with a modern, casual, comfortable, distinctive-but-not-overwhelming Asian flare.    They're not going for discount volume here, but even so, the smallest serving is sufficient to provide an adult a good taste, cool you off, whet the appetite to return, and simultaneously allow you to feel remarkably virtuous for having responsibly indulged in only this dessert lighter-than-air, and having not over done it. That said, what I really want is a bucket for $5 and a spoon.  A large spoon.    Note that it's perfectly acceptable to eat yellow snoh - as long as it's mango.

Stop...just stop what you're doing right now and GO TO SNOH! This is by far one of the most unique places I have ever been. It's much more exciting than your average frozen yogurt or shaved ice place. The decor is friendly and inviting, the customer service impeccable, and the "snoh"...oh the snoh...where do I begin? I had the green tea with mochi balls, red beans and condensed milk. It was satisfying without being too filling, bursting with flavor, yet delicate, and just basically awesome! Needless to say we licked our plate clean. I'm already formulating what my next treat will be!
The snoh is really good. It's a busy place with fast service. I didn't really like the boba there it was too chewy. But if you're going for the snoh you are in the right place.
house blend milk tea - pretty good almond milk tea - pretty good pistachio milk tea - really good it's trendy and clean inside  service is nice

Oh so in love with this place! Boba taro tea (vegan)! Shaved ice is a healthy and delicious alternative to ice cream. And with all the Asian toppings available, it's a perfect place for kids and adults to try something new like mochi balls!  Clean and service is fast and friendly. We like the assortment of games that you can play there with the kids or your date. Especially like the fighting robots!!! Fun!

Such a nice atmosphere, friendly staff, delicious snoh!! If you don't know what to pick, the staff is very helpful and they will recommend flavors if you need help :) will definitely come back before I go back home :)

I Grouponed here and tried snow for the first time, it was pretty good, but it was really "airy". The guy working there wasn't the friendliest either, I asked if he could give me a second since it was my first time (and made sure there were no customers behind me) and he was kinda irritated..but I got my stuff and left. I've tried the Strawberry, Green Tea, Mango, and Taro flavors. For $7, you get a huge tub with two toppings and one glaze. My favorite is the Green Tea, cause I'm obsessed with green tea anything. Then this week I was craving green tea and tried Tea, Snow, and Coffee in Tempe closer to where I moved to and it was soo much better. There, it was creamier and less filled with air, but still very light at the same time. The people who work there are always friendly as well:)

I saw all the great reviews for this place so decided to give it a try! I've had something like this in LA, so was super excited when I saw that they have something similar in AZ!  My boyfriend and I headed over after dinner, and there was no line when we got there. I saw all these amazing flavors, and wanted to try the Mango and Taro. Since we just finished dinner, I asked if I can get two flavors in the small cup. She said no, but said I could if I picked the regular size cup.   So we decided, alright, we don't drive 30 minutes over to this side of the town often, so let's get a regular size cup and try two different flavors! As we told the girl our order, the guy making the Snoh jumped in and said "We can't do that." The girl said, "I thought you can have two flavors if you get the regular size. I already told them that they can get two flavors with the regular cup." The guy says, "No, they can't do that. They can order a large cup and get 2 flavors."  First of all...WHAT?! WHAT?! How hard is it to shave two different flavors of ice into one cup? I'm sorry, but that service is ridiculous. Second of all, if the girl that works there told us so, she should honor it to us this one time. Third of all, another guy that "works" there helped make our small, one flavored Snoh...was sitting on the only couch available when we got there, and went back to sit on the couch with a girl after making our Snoh. If you work there...I don't care if you're a worker or the owner of the store...you don't sit on the couch and play with your phone.   So aside from the terrible service, the Snoh was very good! Ordered mango Snoh with red beans and condensed milk. We were full but we were able to finish that baby up!  Would I go back? Probably not. Unless I'm by that area and am seriously CRAVING it. I rather spend my money for great dessert and great service.

What's better than a shop that offers boba tea, blended slushie/smoothie drinks, and shaved snow? Having them come out to festivals you're going to attend! I've never physically visited the shop but have visited their stands at festivals such as Phoenix Chinese Week, Arizona Matsuri, and the Arizona Asian Festival. I started with their boba slushies/smoothies. The boba was cooked perfectly. I came back to try their shaved snow, so far I've only tried their Thai tea and taro shaved snows. The consistency is fluffy and not runny, the way I like it.

We had mango flavor shaved ice here. It was just like what I got in Singapore and hongkong. It made me so exciting! I also tried their house blend milk tea. It was so good! I love love love! I'll come back again pretty soon. :)
Great place for a fast refreshing sweet treat. Not to mention a great place to hang out with all the games and art work.

A sweet surprise.  I got the Thai Chew (#12).  I cant tell you all of the flavors, but I know it was delicious.  It was not too sweet as well.  What really surprised me was the unique texture of the shaved ice.  It was smooth and surprisingly did not feel cold in my mouth.  I would definitely recommend.

I'm from California and my cousins brought me here in June for the first time. Definitely loved and now I went back to Arizona this month and I had to make sure I'd stop by here right when I landed.  Snoh is really good and has great service! Everytime I go to Arizona this will be my first stop always.
Snoh is dreamy. Pistachio snoh, honey Boba, almond pudding, and condensed milk.  TDF! Our family lives it!

Found a hair intertwined in my ice cream and the manager blamed it on my girlfriend claiming that it was her hair. My girlfriend is blonde and it was a black nappy hair. Go figure the gal making the ice cream had nappy black hair. The manager then continued to glare at me while we sat in there. We went a second time and the same manager with the glasses kept staring at me. Might I be murdered if I go a third time? Not sure... Sketchy
This is the first time and only time I've tried anything like this and I absolutely LOVE this place and product.. Unique, style, & modern.. Awesome.. This is definitely a place is go back to anytime!

Cool place! Love all the original artwork for sale and the overall vibe. I tried the taro shaved ice, green tea mochi, and condensed milk. My boyfriend had the green tea shaved ice, boba, and condensed milk. Both were delicious and not overly sweet. I am excited to try all the other combos. :-)

The best end to a date or treat in the middle of the day. Light and so many options. I usually do a honeydew shake my son gets chocolate with  cinnamon toast crunch on the top with a drizzle of chocolate and my boyfriend gets pistachio with coconut. They have many cereal toppings and many teas boba teas. Many different flavor options. Something for everyone here. My son says he likes ice cream better. I don't blame him ice cream is life. But in the summer a nice cool shaved ice treat is just what I need and love! I recommend this place for anyone! Indomt understand the boba tea thing looks nasty but people seem to love it. Try it out soon.

I'm obsessed. Went there last weekend when I was in the area and haven't stopped thinking about it since! At first I was a bit confused about some of their Snoh bowls, because I didn't understand that these were not snow cones--they're more like shaved ice cream with the texture of fresh powdered snow. I got Mango Snoh with strawberries, mochies, topped condensed milk, and my boyfriend got the Breakfast bowl-- creamy milk Snoh with strawberries and fruity pebbles. All I have to say is that it was so good that we craved it all week and drove almost an hour round trip just to get it again today. I wish they would open more locations!! I highly, highly recommend this place. It is both delicious and a fun experience.
If you want a different type of dessert pick me up, Snoh has you covered. It's a cross between shaved ice and ice cream. #3 is delicious, and looking forward to trying other flavors!

This place with its shaved ice is a completely new concept to me. Probably half of the items on the menu I have never heard before but for the two times that I have been here, I have enjoyed everything I ordered. It may not be for everyone but I think it's definitely worth checking out. The staff is very patient and helpful as well. I'll be back to try more menu items.

So good! So glad I came in to try this "snow". We get there on a Sunday night and the place is full of people, pretty cool, loud, a little rowdy but awesome nonetheless. Even with all the orders, we got our snow pretty quickly. I had the boba in my passion tea and it was delicious!! They also have games for you and your group to play while you chill there. Super cool place(:

This place is amazing!!! So so so good.  I've been coming here for a few months. They have anything from smoothies, milk teas, and of course snoh!  They so many topping to pick from, their milk teas are pretty good too.  The environment is chill and relax. Great for family or friends hanging out. They have a couple of board games to help pass times. It can get rather busy at times but the service is always quick and customer service is on point. I will recommend this place if you haven't been! My person favorite is purple fusion with boba and mochi.

Oh, Snoh, how I love you soh! This place is great. Think ultimate snow cone- except the ice isn't packed very tightly so it's light and fluffy, and instead of straight sugar syrup the flavors are creamy and refreshing- with toppings galore!  It's like a raspado's Asian cousin. The staff was very helpful, offering pairing suggestions for this newbie. I tried the Thai tea flavor with mochi and boba, then the green tea with pineapple and almond cookies on a second visit. So good.

Was in the area so I finally stopped by. Busy but it only took a few minutes to place my order, then I waited 7 minutes until it was ready. I got Thai Tea snow with boba and Nutella glaze. So good! I don't really like the icy consistency but I mixed it and then it was creamy and delicious. Not enough Nutella but I added some when I got home. Friendly staff! Hope to be back.
The ladies working were incredibly nice! They were confident about the flavors on the menu and helped me try out a new favorite!

Great place to have dessert after a heavy meal. My friend and I come here quite a bit and each time we leave happy and smiling. We always get the thai tea, it's the perfect balance of robust tea and sweet cream without being so sweet that you're thirsty for water.  The decor is very modern, with art work all over the wall mixed in with two hd TVs, the place itself has great lighting and isn't dark at all, gives it that perfect weather hangout atmosphere and the best part is that everyone is welcomed here from kids to adults and hippies to hipsters LOL.  New favorite flavor is the the regular cream milk tea accompanied by the red velvet(limited time flavor) with strawberries all over, perfect for valentines. Check the photo :)
I love Snoh! The Thai tea with but boba is my favorite! I get it all the time it's a guilty pleasure

Love this place. So sad when we moved further away from it, but worth the drive. The fianc√© and I love splitting a medium Thai tea snoh with boba and mochii drizzled in condensed milk. Their cotton candy flavor is a second favorite of mine. Our go to place when friends and family come from out of town. The art hanging around is super cool and the place is always clean. The line gets a little crazy around dessert time, but the service is quick and painless. Definitely worth signing up for their phone communication, they are always bringing me back in with those deals and Thai tea Tuesdays.

This is a great place to take kids & enjoy your time. The snoh and teas are great, but the customer service is horrible. They've messed up my orders three different times and each of the times they question me like if I'm lying. I returned the tea once cuz it was made wrong and the girls behind the counter kept starring. The manager tried to tell me that I was wrong. I don't think I'll go again after these incidents. Other than the people, the snoh and teas are great (if you get the right one). If you go in the middle of the day, the employees are much nicer.

This is one one my favorite places to get boba! The flavors they have for all the drinks are just perfect! I always get the House Blend Milk Tea With Boba It's super affordable too! All the workers are super friendly which is a Huge bonus. Definitely worth giving it a try!

this place is Special...it is no Shaved ICE place like Ive seen in the valley...its SHAVED yes but the way they explain how is nothing short of really smart and lots of ingenuity ...here you don't have to worry about sticky messy syrup everywhere. and every bite has your flavor...its really impressive.  want to get your email...how about their free wifi..yes this is an indoor place so when its 120 your not melting outsidse trying to enjoy your treat  they have tvs art work you can purchase right off the wall and uno . books. dominos//  its a really hip place with great people to meet and talk to...I really enjoyred it and will be returning

Well I was a little nervous to try this whole boba thing but now I'm hooked! The honeydew was a bit too sweet for me but almond milk tea is right up my alley. Next on my list is the red velvet snoh. I may even venture out to having some red bean or rainbow jelly toppings! Hooked for sure

The shaved ice is unique and good.  The ambiance and service lacking...Would i come back? no...not even if i was craving it because service SUCKS...  Rude wanna be's here.    I'd give 1 star but that wouldn't be fair to the shaved ice.

Super Yummy! The place is incredibly delicious! The staff is friendly and helpful with the daunting task of choosing your flavor and toppings. The taro ice with green tea mochi balls and boba is my favorite! They also have boba tea which I'm excited about because there isn't any place around here that has that. Go try it if you haven't already. Best desert in town! ADDICTED!

I love this place!! My friends and I come here for dessert every time we eat out! I always get the taro and pistachio snoh! The condensed milk is to die for!! But seriously, this is my favorite place to get shaved ice! Their milk tea is super good too! And their brick toast is pretty amazing!

Believe it or not, there was a time when snoh was what many people considered to be the best-kept secret of Taiwanese culture. But that seems to have slowly started changing over the last several years - as places like this have started popping up more frequently.  If this were the first snoh place I'd ever tried, I'd probably be a bit more enthusiastic. There's a bit of a novelty appeal for many people, as it's something different in a neighborhood that's mostly filled with your usual ice cream/gelato joints. I appreciate that. But if you walk in here with pre-established expectations based on prior experiences, you'll probably just find it to be average at best.  By the time my girlfriend and I finally got around to trying this location, we'd already tried snoh at a handful of Vietnamese restaurants as a quietly advertised dessert option.  First of all, the fact that this place actually markets itself as a snoh shop, rather than tucking it away as a hidden dessert item that's buried amongst 500 other drinks and dishes is very smart marketing. Snoh can easily stand on its own as a great treat, similar to ice cream or shaved ice. And when done right, it can be quite impressive.  I really like the setup, especially all of their wall art, showing various nods to 8-bit era video games. There's Jenga (a game synonymous with snoh for some reason) and a handful of other board games available for play. They also serve slushies, teas, and brick toast. We finally tried it on a recent visit and were very disappointed. From what I read brick toast is supposed to be baked. They merely cut a slice from a (very dry) loaf of bread and dumped toppings on it. I'm still not sure if this was a mistake or if they're just lazy in their preparation.   For a first timer, you'll probably really enjoy it. It's light, fluffy, and much easier on the stomach than ice cream. They offer a variety of flavors and toppings here, which is far more vast than what you can find at other places. Unfortunately, at least by my tastes, I feel the snoh is a bit on the icier side. The best snoh I've had usually steers more towards a creamier texture, but who am I to say what's right and what's wrong? The place feels kind of like a high school hangout - not that there's anything wrong with that.  There's a second location that also appears to be doing quite well, so it appears that snoh is no longer a secret.  Recommended to try out.

Wonderful little shop. Staff is amazingly kind and helpful. I had never tried anything like their shaved ice cream, but it was wonderfully delicious and fluffy. I would definitely recommend trying it out.

I've been in a few times and every time it's been amazing. They bring you a new style of dessert. There are plenty of items to choose from. I just loved the shaved ice and the brick toast. Every one that works there understands that it's a different style dessert and are happy to help you.

food: mango tango. they ran out of fresh mangoes and subbed in lychee. which was a fine alternative. the caramel made it sweet. it's not big on the mango flavor. enough to make it a dessert. ***3/5  service: it can take some time to get your order. there are board games around to kill time. free wifi too. the place looks cool. lots of pop culture art pieces around.  ***4/5  value: it's fairly large cup. perfect to share with somebody, but also doable on your own. i take it as a challenge for myself. ***4/5

I've always wanted to try a place like this, and I have finally manage to find one. This place has a nice ambiance and the people here are super friendly. Ordering to go is super simple and you get it fairly quickly. Their menu is very easy to chose from and they have combos that make it easier to chose from. Next time I'll have to try the brick toast.
My favorite ice cream & dessert place, 10 miles away from where I live. I wish they can open a store in Tempe
So yummy. This is my ultimate treat. I love the sesame drizzle and the condensed milk drizzle. Try the Thai Tea flavor

Visiting from Boston, my friends and I scavenged the area for good shaved ice. We landed at Snoh and what a pleasant experience we got! This is an AWESOMELY decorated and hip dessert joint that offers custom or premade shaved ice bowls, slushies, bubble tea, ice cream, Vietnamese iced coffee, Pocky, and Hi Chew. I tried the houseblend milk bubble tea and it was perfect! The bubble teas come in one size - a large. The boba was of the perfect texture and the milk tea was flavorful without being too sugary.   The customizable Snoh bowls are AWESOME! You can grab a small, medium or large.  Flavors: black sesame, coconut, cotton candy, honey dew, matcha, mango, pistachio, red velvet, strawberry, taro, Thai tea  Toppings: almond cookies, almond pudding, banana chips, cinammon toast crunch, coconut flakes, custard pudding, fruity pebbles, graham crackers, grass jelly, green apple jelly, honey boba, lychee jelly, m&ms, mango, marshmallows, mango pudding, mochi balls, Oreo cookies, pecan, pineapple, rainbow jelly, red bean, sprinkles, sliced almond, strawberry, taro pudding  Glazes: black sesame, butterscotch,  caramel, chocolate, condensed milk, and nutella  I wish I lived around here to come back! The staff was extremely friendly. The owner was manning down the counter and talked to us while we were chilling and playing board games! If you're reading this, thank you for the amazing experience and delicious shaved ice and bubble tea!   There's plenty of parking options at this strip mall. Definitely come by for dessert and when you do, check out the wall art and grab a cute sticker. There's plenty of seating options, WiFi, fun wooden mustaches and glasses to take pictures with friends, as well as board games like Jenga and Connect 4.

The snoh and teas here are great! Winter melon tastes exactly like an actual winter melon! Other flavors taste like the actual fruits as well. Their service is good and sometimes there is an extremely long line though.

Snoh is one of the most well established Asian hang out spots I have ever stepped foot in. There is boba, shaved ice, shaved ice and boba and their new brock toast. The variety of flavors is decent for boba but the shaved ice is really what makes the place special. The snoh has the fluffiest texture and each flavor such as thai tea, matcha, mango and cream. The toppings just add an extra pop or crunch to the cold fusion in your mouth. The ice is not too sweet so the addition of glaze creates the perfect amount of sweetness for a refreshing dessert. I recently tried their brick toast which is the most delicious way to get diabetes if you are into chocolate and banana with vanilla ice cream.         The vibe is quite chill and their music selection is alright, at least it's not too annoying or loud.  The staff is friendly and the service is fast except for the brick toast which takes them 10 minutes but it is worth it. Overall I recommend the place for just a chill hangout as there are games and such in the back and interesting decor that is comfortable to relax in.

So good!  It's the perfect combination between shave ice and ice cream.  It's so fluffy and melts right when it touches your tongue like real snow.  Such great toppings and flavors to choose from and I love their mango pudding!  Slightly expensive for my taste, but it is a specialty item.  Perfect for a hot day in Arizona!

If you want brick toasts, go on Thursdays. They sell out quick because that's is the only thing this place is really famous for. I like their drinks but their shaved snow was just not the best for me since I've had better. The brick toast is my favorite so I try to get one every time I'm in the area on Thursdays. It's always sold out on weekends and Fridays because they get really busy those three days. The place is nice to chill at as well since they have games like connect the dots and jenga to play while waiting or just killing time with friends. They also have free wifi and the password is located near the little hidden Asian snacks area by the cashier.
My sweet tooth go-to!! Really chill environment and the shaved ice is just addicting. Have been here so many times and I can't get enough.

We loved this place.  One gal had a pineapple and condensed milk which had a good texture and a smoothness like ice cream but much lighter.  Another had strawberry snoh with red beans.  Good combo.  Even the plain grape snoh was tasty and refreshing.  The general atmosphere was friendly and inviting.  It wouldn't take much to get us to go back.

This is the most amazing dessert place in Phoenix. They have the best snow in all of Arizona!   The mix of ice cream and shaved ice is to die for. The flavors that they carry, along with the toppings and drizzle flavors are all so good.  If you come here you won't regret it, it's much better than any Coldstone or Dairy Queen.  Just be open minded and give Snoh a try !!

Had the taro shaved ice with lychee jellies and crumbled almond cookie. It was fantastic!!!!!! The combo of flavors and textures were perfect. My dessert wasn't to sweet or to filling. It was just right. Yummmm!!!!!!! I'll be back very soon. It was so worth the drive! :)

Fluffy sweetness in the hot Arizona weather with customized toppings?  I'm in! As a former Lollicup employee in my minimum wage days, this place is legit and even better than Lollicup.  Perfect boba texture and flavorful tea that is a relief from the powdered stuff.  Love it!

I was only visiting Arizona and trying to decide which good food places would make my trip worth while and this place definitely made the cut. I loved the ice cream here because it was so refreshingly different. It's still creamy, but compacted together on a plate rather than a cup or cone and the flavors are ones that are hard to find at any other ice cream or frozen yogurt place. If you're looking for a regular cup of ice cream, this isn't for you, but if you want to try something original with different flavors and texture, I definitely recommend Snoh.

BIG fan!! A friend of mine and I were walking by and thought we'd drop in and I must say I'm so glad we did! The place is charming, the staff was wonderful, a very tasty treat and I will be back! I can't wait to try other flavor combos =)

Snoh is a little creative ice boba shop. There are no boba smoothies. Do not come here if you are looking for a boba smoothie. The closest thing you will find to a boba smoothie are the slushes. I had the mango slush with honey boba and boy did i savor it! Refreshing and tasty!! Perfect for those warm days :) my husband had the strawberry slush with honey boba. We weren't able to try any of their desserts, but we will be back another day to give that a try.  The parking is tight and the location is among a good plaza. The restrooms are male/female and always dirty- boo.  Based on drinks alone, i give 5 stars. Overall though.... 4. Great ice shavery but it needs to be kept clean.

Ice, Ice Baby!   This tasty treat tantalizes your taste buds like none other could, and the fun games, gadgets and eye candy that adorns the walls are the delicious cherries on top.   Despite countless visits (sometimes even within the same day, shhhh) I never seem to tire of scraping my bowl down to the very last sliver. Even after returning from a very extended vacay in Asia (home of all things boba) this was one of my very first, very satisfying stops.   Taro with condensed milk, mochi, and lychee is the go-to that I crave, but I dare you to discover a combination that disappoints.   If and when you make an attempt to fulfill said dare, (why wouldn't you?) do be sure to place some $ into the super nifty super hero tip jar (preferably Ironman's). You gotta give kudos for creativity and the  customer service is always impeccable. Also, whomever is in charge of the music playlist is really on to something good.     Pretty sure it's impossible to dislike this place, so just go. Eat, play, enjoy:)
Love this place! Had Snoh two days in a row ! The green tea snoh with red bean and custard is my favorite. Great tasting milk teas also!!!! So addicted !!
The best shaved ice known to man. We just ordered it off of Uber eats. Unbelievable experience!

I LOVE SNOH! ^__^ You will find all your shaved ice dreams at this Ice Shavery! Especially with the wide variety of ice cream flavors form toppings... it's hard to ever come across a customer not saying good things about Snoh! I love the staff as well. They are nice genuine hard-working people that a few I've known personally who I can say deserve to be apart of such a great business. Snoh has definitely made an impact locally in AZ and they deserve to have been able to open up a second shop in Downtown Phx. EVERYONE must try Snoh, I promise you'll be dying to come back for more xoxo

5/29/13  Winding down from the CMYE at Del Frisco's, someone brought up an impromptu UYE at Snoh Ice Shavery, and since I've never been and had been craving for shave ice, such as that I experienced in Honolulu, I needed no other prompting to go.  Snoh is located in the same plaza as Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe (another bookmark I've had since moving into the valley many, many years ago- now I know where it's located, I'm going to have to stop in for a try!)  Parking looks very decent for the number of businesses around here- a big plus!  The line can get long very fast, but the two guys behind the counter take the orders very quickly (or as quickly as they can when newbies, such as myself, come in for the first time and are faced with so many choices!).  I decided to take the easy way out and try a couple of shaved ice flavors and a few toppings, so I went with the "large plate" for $6.75.  I spent my first decade, born and raised, in Manila, so I am very familiar with taro (we Tagalogs know it as "ube") ice cream, so I had to try Snoh's icy version, and added Green tea to the mix.  My toppings were cubed mango, red mung beans, and black sesame condensed milk.  It took about 8 to 10 minutes, but we had a large group present, and our lively conversations made the wait very easy.  This is what waited for me at the counter when my name was called... http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/snoh-ice-shavery-phoenix?userid=M9rRM6Eo5YbKLKMG5QiIPA#jyv16LcyCFb3Cz-Q3CkDxg  I have to say that while it didn't look very appetizing (mango cubes didn't present well, and neither did the black sesame drizzle-- why not just pour the milk, let it cascade down the icy landscapes, and just sprinkle roasted black sesame seeds on top?), I loved the taro, red mung bean, and black sesame condensed milk combo.  I thought the condensed milk overpowered the green tea ice, and I wouldn't order that match again.  However, I wouldn't mind having ust green tea ice.  It tasted very fresh and clean-- a great palate cleanser after a great meal.  Cool artwork and backsplashes.  Nice concept of posting photos of guests on the TV display, but does the staff check for total complacency of all those present in the pics, I wonder?  I can see privacy breaches becoming an issue...   Will be taking family over for a few treats here in the future, I'm sure!

I was super excited when I stumbled upon Snoh Ice Shavery while in the parking lot of Oreganos next door because I loved shaved ice. Overall it was alright. I was expecting more of a straight forward shaved iced option which I didn't find or possibly just didn't see so I settled for a passion fruit slush. I opted to get whipped cream on the top for an extra 75 cents. The whip cream ended up turning into a creamy fruit mush at the end which I totally loved and my boyfriend hated. Fruit tasted fresh.  They had a lot of different menu items and choices and they offer condensed milk topping. Definitely interested in trying their other creations but not good for just shaved ice.  Overall I paid almost $7 for a slushy with whipped cream.

Went here and was so impressed. Song has some legit ice and flavors!  I got the taro with strawberry toppings and condensed milk.  The employees are super friendly and welcoming!  Go check them out and enjoy a nice snoh on a Hot day

Hands down this place has the best Boba I have had in years!! My son loved the chocolate shaved ice. The house blend tea is also amazing. Anyone looking for a new treat should try this place. Plus the prices can not be beat!

I don't make a habit of giving businesses 5-stars if they don't deserve it.  However, in this case, Snoh Ice Shavery deserves every star.  I have made it a tradition of visiting this business every Friday to start the weekend off with a bang.  It is the opposite direction of my house and I usually get stuck in traffic, but it's worth the trouble.  I have been here 3-4 times now and have ordered something different every time.  All of it was good.  I don't know what I'm ordering half the time, but I am always pleasantly surprised by the flavors and quality of ingredients.  Dang it.  I wish I didn't reside in the West Valley.  Just writing this review is making me hungry for more.
I always try something new when I come here and let me just say yum yum yum! It's different but it's so good ;)   The people are friendly and the environment of the place is fun.

Really unique shaved ice... and the most amazing I've ever had! Tastes like ice cream. The condensed milk topping really makes it perfect! My favorites are thai tea with almond cookies or cinnamon toast crunch, topped with condensed milk; or the taro topped with mochi and condensed milk. You've got to check this place out! Wish they were still staying open until 10pm sitll....

This is a nice spot for some sweet treats. I always get the shaved ice and teas, they never disappoint. They have several flavor combinations to offer you, but you can also make your own. Only thing we did not like was the overall cleanliness of this establishment. We've been there about five times, and every time we go the tables are always dirty and sticky. It is very small in there so I can agree with the other helpers who say it can get chaotic in there. A fav tea of ours is the passion fruit tea with raspberry

Probably one of the best boba and shaved snow places in all of phx! I definitely have to recommend this place for the shaved snow and drinks. It's hard to find stuff this good out in phx. Hopefully they'll open up more of these locales around the valley.

Last weekend I just happened to be in this part of town and after hearing many of my Yelp friends rave about Snoh, I had to give it a try. It was totally not what I expected. I've had snow cones and raspados many times so I thought I knew what to expect from a shaved ice dessert but man I was way off. It was so light and fluffy it is hard to describe it. I think Karen W. said it best when she compared it to frozen cotton candy. Not the taste mind you, just the texture and consistency. I ordered the Thai Tea and the snow by itself was very mild in flavor. But then they let you add all kinds of toppings so I got crushed almond cookies and boba with caramel syrup. They keep everything separate in the bowl rather than mixing it like Cold Stone ice cream because that would ruin the light and fluffy snoh. So, I really liked it that the cookies didn't get soggy and the boba didn't freeze. Each spoonful I tried to get a little bit of each element and I have to say that is a pretty good flavor combination I came up with on my first attempt. It was delicious! The place is small but cute and all the staff seemed friendly. Definitely worth a try if you haven't been before.

Ever since I've tried Snoh for the first time, I crave their mango slush with honey boba quite often. :) Normally, and quite regularly, I go to the downtown location, however tried the camelback location today. Parking at this location is quite a nightmare, as it's right next to a very busy Oreganos and is located on a very busy road, however, the craziness is definitely worth battling for the deliciousness of Snoh! Because I love the mango slush with honey boba so much, I'm yet to try anything else on the menu, however, the menu is extensive and seems to cover just about any sweet craving!
I've been craving bubble tea since moving to Phoenix. This was a pleasant surprise that satisfied my craving and now a new favorite! Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
Love love this place great treats and love their house milk tea with boba :). One day I'm gonna try the brick toast and the Taro, everything either looks delicious or is delicious!!!

I love this place! It's right in front of my best friend's apartment. I love how they're expanding their menu but i still need to try the brick toast. Anyway, i love their taro and black sesame shaved ice top with condensed milk and boba and red bean. Mmmm The best shaved ice ever!

I have a new favorite dessert place! Snoh's shaved ice is like no other in the Phoenix area. It has a light, whipped texture, almost like cotton candy. Also, the ice itself is flavored before it's shaved. When you order at the counter, you get your choice of flavor (e.g., Original, Thai tea, mango, green tea, taro), toppings (1 included for small, 2 included for medium and large), and glaze (e.g., sesame, condensed milk, chocolate, caramel).  So far I've had the mango and the taro, and I prefer the taro. The portions are very generous, and 3-4 people can easily share a large size. There are numerous toppings to choose from (Including fresh fruit, mochi, and puddings). The only thing I wished they had was a fruity glaze, like maybe a strawberry or raspberry.  The decor is hip, and they are always playing a quirky movie on the TV. Iron Sky, anyone?

I haven't actually tried any of their Snoh desserts but everything looks delish!  I come here solely for a boba tea fix and they do not disappoint.  Their house blend milk tea hits the spot and their boba is cooked perfectly.  If they had a location in Old Town I'd be a daily regular for sure!
Best passion fruit boba smoothies in the valley.  They are meticulous about the consistency of the boba.  It's perfect every time.

walked in and it felt like I was in some California suburb where a bunch of private schools try and act "with it" with their faux gansta clothes.  This is one of those places that embraces yelp so hard that they get 5 stars because they have such an online presence but they actual food itself was very mediocre.  its tasted too sweet and didn't have any flavor.
Great service, awesome boba milk tea. Friendly staff. Definitely recommend this place.

My best friend and I went here after lunch for a treat! At first I didn't really want to try it. I was only there because my friend insisted we go. She ordered a taro with green tea mochi balls and I have to admit it was delicious! Don't judge a book by its cover!
The honey dew flavor is so fire. Came here w my friends after we had sushi next door to this place and it's great hang out with all the board/card games!
Nice environment and great snow ice. Can't find a better one in Phoenix.

First of the snoh here is delicious! My favorite flavors are the Coco Loco and the Gotcha Matcha. This place has a very cool and relaxing vibe. It's a nice place to sit and hang out with friends and enjoy some snoh. The employees are always very nice and friendly.

the staff is very friendly and this is the first boba spot to open in midtown central phoenix the name is very creative the art is very fun this is a wonderful place to bring your family and friends it's a nice place to hang out for a bit. the snoh is very unique and i really enjoy it i come to this place often

Yum, I am in love with the green tea with condensed milk and mochi balls.  My daughter with the original with chocolate and cinnamon toast crunch (not on the menu).  It is light and refreshing and cools you off on these incredibly hot phoenix days.  I plan on trying one of their teas, eventually, but for now I am content with the shaved ice.  Unique and tasty option in place of ice cream or frozen yogurt.

So I absolutely love this place..love the different flavors love the verity. .it is small and loud though.  I would have totally given it a 5 stars...BUT the last 2 times we have gone in, in less than a month,  everything we wanted they are out of...granted it's a busy place and it's a happen spot but make sure you are very well stocked on the weekends. ..

I have heard a lot of good things about Snoh Ice and this is my first time to try it! It was more than spectacular! The shave ice it so yummy and so healthy! I saw so many toppings to pick and very good customer service too! Highly recommended!

Cool atmosphere, games available jenga, uno etc.... Being our first time here we had questions, but the girl at the register was not very helpful nor was she friendly. We got a Taro (coconut milk flavor) w/pineapple and condensed milk topping it was ok sorta left an after taste. My friend got the Milk cream (vanilla flavor) w/strawberries and nutella topping...hers was yummy. It would be helpful to offer a sample to first timers.....

Every Asian I know has posted pics of this place...yes in Phoenix Arizona you can find some Asian delishness!  I've tried the green tea and the original flavor but love my strawberry shaved ice! I've stuck with my favorite Strawberry with Chocolate and Coconut Mochi Balls. Not two sweet and just the right amount of sauce and toppings.  All of my friends have gone at least twice, it's an addiction!  The staff has always been friendly.  I've been there during a weekday mid morning and at night, people kept coming in to try Snoh.   Some who know about this type of shaved ice or just curious foodies!

Service: 5/5 Drinks/shaved ice: 5/5  Ambience: 5/5   I'm from New York and after doing some yelping, I found this place not too far from where I'm staying at.   When I walked in, I was captivated by the comics to the right. As I walked right in, a friendly girl welcomed me and was very accommodating when I wanted to switch my drink.   I ordered the gotcha matcha and mangonada.  I felt that the Matcha from Gotcha Matcha didn't have enough matcha flavors, but it was still delicious. The red bean and mochi that came with the order tasted standard and similar to the NY places.   At first I also ordered a Pomegranate ice tea with honey boba but after waiting for my ice and drink, I saw their advertised Mangonada on the TV off the menu. I guess it was new but it got my attention. I went to ask the girl if I could change my drink since she hasn't made it yet. She was very accommodating and super friendly about it!   I will definitely be coming back if I ever visit Phoenix again!

Holy balls this place was good.  I got the Thai tea flavor with boba, shaved coconut, condensed milk and black sesame seeds.  It was decadent, creamy,fluffy and not too sweet.  I can't wait to come back.

I was introduced to Snoh by a coworker and have been back numerous times since. There was even a time where I went two weekends in a row. I don't even live close to Snoh but I'll make the trip out there any day.  No, Snoh is not a snow cone place. The best way to describe the texture is to compare it to fresh fluffy snow... or if you've ever ice skated before and used to make a pile of snow with your blades, it's a lot like that. The flavor is mixed in to the ice and isn't a syrup that they put on top. It's super light and refreshing. It's a great treat to have in the day to cool down or perfect for dessert after a meal.  I've tried their taro, strawberry, mango, honeydew, red velvet, and black sesame flavors. My favorites are mango and red velvet. With the mango (my usual go-to), I usually get lychee jelly and light condensed milk on it. The red velvet was a seasonal flavor but also one of my favorites. It was so good with the chocolate sauce. I wish they'd bring it back!  I've also tried their lychee bubble tea with lychee jelly in it. I haven't found a place in the Valley with good bubble tea until Snoh opened. It's so hard to decide whether or not I want Snoh or their bubble tea when I go in though.  If you go frequently, ask for their punch card!

Updaaate! My last review of Snoh's was based on my first taste of this awesome Taiwanese dessert. Since then, I've been out there, I've seen things, I've lived...What I really mean is that I've tried other places in both Arizona and California alike which also serve boba and this delicious shaved ice concoction. Though they all have things that I like and dislike, Snoh Ice Shavery ultimately prevailed.  Price-wise, they're all pretty much on par. I honestly feel like you get more snoh at Snoh's because most other places will serve you your dessert on a plate, whereas Snoh's will pack it down into a cup for you. So it may seem like you're getting more on a plate at these other places, but really, it's fluff. Plus, of the places I've been to, Snoh's is way more generous with their toppings which I really appreciate since I think the different toppings really add different textures and flavors to your dessert. I love Snoh's variety of flavors and toppings, and they always manage to keep things fresh by coming up with seasonal toppings or flavors which are handwritten on a little whiteboard next to the register. (I personally am waiting for them to bring in red bean snoh, which I've seen at other places but have yet to see at Snoh's.) Their decor is pretty awesome, with their walls covered in pop culture themed artworks and two flat screens playing some sitcom or movie from the '80s or '90s. It's definitely a spot to hang out at, with games from your childhood, scattered at the various tables. The crowds come in waves so I don't really have any recommendations on the best time to check this place out, but if you're in the mood for some shaved ice this Summer (or anytime, really), definitely give Snoh's a shot!
Refreshing desserts you can't find anywhere else in Phoenix. Fun place to hang out and even get some work done. Almond pudding = almond jello!

My favorite place for Snoh in Phoenix!  The staff is always friendly and knowledgeable.  My favorite flavor is honeydew!  I tried the dairy free pistachio tonight and it was fantastic!  Loving the new combo menu too!  Keep up the good work!  Love this place!

Such a sweet treat on a hot summer day! I love the snoh here! I'm a fan of the taro, green tea, and black sesame with mochi, almond jello, and condensed milk. Any of these choices in any combination. The presentation makes it that much more tasty!

I was in this area last night and stopped here for the first time.  It was a bit chaotic, screaming kids and loud teenagers.  I walked up to the counter to check out the menu, handed my sister 20 bucks and told her to get me the usual thai tea with boba. There was one girl taking orders while another girl was calling peoples names repeatedly, I guess the customers couldn't hear her over the screams of the kids. So, I walked back towards the exit, and found a table that was empty, it was dirty with crumbs all over it, whatever I thought, just get my drink and leave was the plan. The tea was alright, there was too much boba in it. I was trying to drink all the tea while leaving the excess of boba in the cup...not easy.  As I was leaving the parking lot I tried to go out the south on to Camelback...well some idiot blocked the exit. So annoying!  Would I go back to this place? No. Was the tea good? Eh. Not terrible.  I'll have to try the downtown location next, since it is closer to me.

It tasted a lot better than I thought it would. In fact, it was the best shaved snow I had here in the Phoenix area, so far.  I love coconut, so I got the coconut shaved ice, added coconut shavings and custard pudding. I regret I didn't get the Large for myself... I got the smallest size :( SO DELICIOUS and I constantly crave it... it's too bad this place is 40 minutes from where I live... otherwise I would be going there multiple times a week!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
I love this place so much! They only have the one location right now but there is one opening up in downtown Phoenix but one in Tempe would be awesome! I love going here for some sweet treats!!

Ok this is by far my favorite dessert spot! I come here at least once a week. I've tried a lot of stuff from their menu. Different varieties of snohs. But honestly I think my all time favorite is the Thai tea snoh. At first this shaved ice leaves you a little confused is it shaved ice? Is it ice cream? NO ONE KNOWS! Lol the texture is super crazy. Also I am super picky when it come to boba and they cook theirs to perfection not too soggy not to hard just right!  I highly suggest their Vietnamese coffee with boba splendid!

Delicious! The shave ice+ toppings combo is amazing. A great selection of flavors, toppings and glazes. We tried strawberry with mochi balls, mango pudding and condensed milk. I love that the shave ice isnt overly sweet. Fun interior, clean, friendly service... Will return to try more flavors and the bubble tea!

****Environment: The place is nicely decorated. I really like the artsy look with comics, paintings, drawings and portraits along side the way. It definitely gives me that modern, urban feel. The seats and tables are well spaced and there is a cool are to play board games, cards, checkers, etc. The bathroom was out of order at the time which is understandable and not their fault.  ***Food: Snoh, I would describe is a healthier alternative from eating ice cream. That's how I would put it at least. I feel if one is wanting their sweet tooth craved, but not wanting to guilty calories and sugar, this would be the place for it. It's almost like you're eating air/clouds with flavor. Literally the ice is shaved so thin and fluffy that it feels like nothing is in your mouth. The only thing I feel though was that the flavor was not enough. I'm not really a sweet tooth kind of guy but seriously, I felt there could be a bit or flavor. Even with the toppings I still felt like the Pistachio Snoh Combo cup was lacking flavor. I understand I'm trying to eat healthy but if they were to add a little more flavor to the ice, it would definitely boost my rating up. I felt the only flavor I was enjoying was the toppings.  **Service: I felt like the service was a little on the down side. I didn't feel welcomed by the cashier. It was more a feeling like that person didn't want to be there. I'm not sure if it was just a bad/raining day causing that type of mood, but I just wanted to order my stuff and get out.   Overall, if you really are looking to be healthy and craving sweets without that guilty conscious, you might be able to fulfill it here. However if you sweet tooth is more intense, you definitely will be disappointed and look like a sad panda!
Amazingly delicious! And the staff is fantastic!!! Boba tea & SNOH! Recommend the Thai tea flavor in both!

Why wouldn't I rate 5 stars at snoh? Cause it's amazing that's why! Original, and fun and a quirky place for your frozen desserts and  refreshing teas! If you don't love Thai tea your missing out and this is the spot to be and get it. Interior is wondering when you walk in, it's like you walked into a mini comi-con all sorts of people from different waves come into here. Specially located in midtown on camelback! When I come in I'm never disappointed, they do need to have sizes for the brick toast but I mean I'm not complaining just for people who can't finish it all. My favorite is the thai-chew which is the #12 if you can't make up your mind or don't know what to do with your custom order! Love love love the black sesame sauce it's my favorite and I think goes well with almost anything? They also do daily specials here which is my favorite, cause I like a good deal! Definitely come in, specially if you are feeling this heat, but don't feel the heat too much! Stay hungry and cool Phoenix!

This place is alright. To be honest i wouldnt be back. I had high expectations and seeing so many great reviews i was excited to try this place. I was extremely let down.. Being that its my first time i wasnt able to try the flavors. This sucked because i would have loved to try one of their cool flavors before i got it rather than just paying for something i may not like..  To start, i ordered 2 #10's with marshmellow to add on both. I didnt get very many strawberries, and seeing others get a lot turned me off..  The oreos, which i had A TON of were just stale. They tasted as if they had been sitting out or expired. I ended up scooping out all the oreos because it was just gross.  The marshmellows that i had added were the highlight of it, even though it was just a regular marshmellow.  I asked for nutella and got chocolate sauce. Figures. As far as the "snoh" goes, its alright. The strawberry snoh does not really taste like anything. Kinda hard to like or dislike something if it doesnt really have too much flavor.  We ended up throwing away our snoh not even finishing it. The games were disgusting and havent been wiped down for ages it looks like. For the price i could have went to another place and had a better experience. $14 is ridiculous to pay for "snoh" if im barely getting toppings, the place is dirty and i dont even get the right toppings. As far as my friends snoh, they didnt enjoy it either. They wont be back, and sadly neither will i. To each their own.  Sadly yelp failed me on this one.

I stop by once a week to pick up drinks for work. I usually get their Vietnamese coffee and lychee tea with lychee jelly. The coffee has the right amount of espresso for my long night shift. They pretty much know my order. Because I buy a lot of drinks the cup holders are very important and I prefer the cardboard holder with the handles and the new bags they have now. I had some issues spilling my drinks all over the place. I have presented my issues. Overall, I love the shaved ice and the drinks here! It's a chill place to hang out too. My friends at work love this place too and I get requests to bring in drinks all the time
The texture and softness of snoh is to die for! It's light weight almost like you're not eating any calories! The place is small but clean. I recommend the pistachio snoh.

We just tried to order online and it was too late so the system booted us off and when we drove in we hit every single red light, it was terrible. Got there 1 minute before close and they were nice enough to still serve us. It was really tasty too, such a great first time. Thank you

The worst part about this place is deciding what to have.    The shop itself is funky and artsy and hip.  The menu is fun and unique.  If you want a shaved ice, you can choose to order pre- designed ingredients, like the breakfast bowl snoh or go rogue and mix and match what you want.  I chose the latter and had mango shaved ice with pineapple chunks and caramel drizzled.  But also had to try the breakfast bowl Snoh too.  Who can resist fruity pebbles?   Both were extremely delicious and refreshing too.  The employee was very knowledgeable and patient while I figured out what I wanted.
